Title: Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Was du bei uns machst

Die Analyse und Strukturierung von Daten lässt dein Herz höher schlagen? Außerdem behälst du den Blick aufs große Ganze und weißt genau welche strategischen Empfehlungen den Kunden glücklich machen? Wenn du dazu noch eine Leidenschaft für Werbung hast und dich in einem lebendigen und kreativen Umfeld weiterentwickeln möchtest, bist du bei uns genau richtig!


Entwicklung und Pflege von Dashboards
Entwicklung und Erstellung von Reportings für Kunden
Erstellung von Audiences und Insights als Basis für Strategieausarbeitungen
Ableitung von Handlungsempfehlungen
Unterstützung bei der Erarbeitung von Kanalstrategien und strategischen Empfehlungen für Kunden im Bereich Datenanalyse/Reporting
Unterstützung der Kolleg*innen bei der Interpretation von Daten
Aufbau und Vorantreiben der Dateninfrastruktur des Teams


Was du mitbringst


Du hast bereits Berufserfahrung im Bereich Social Media in einer digitalen Agentur mit dem Schwerpunkt Datenanalyse gesammelt (Performance Agentur, Mediaagentur)
Du bringst Kenntnisse in der Social Media Analyse von Tools mit (zB Facebook Business Manager, Twitter Analytics, Instagram Analytics, Emplifi etc.), sowie Kenntnisse in der Visualisierung von Tools und Datenbanken (zB Tableau, Looker Studio, Power BI, IBM Kognos / SQL, MS SQL, P SQL)
Du hast bereits fundierte Erfahrung mit Web- und Marketing Analytics (zB Google Analytics, SAS, Salesforce, Adobe, Microsoft etc.)
Du besitzt fachliches Know How in Global Web Index oder Best4Planning
Besonders deine Erfahrungen mit Looker Studio und Supermetrics bringst du erfolgreich bei uns ein
Du besitzt die Fähigkeit Social Media KPIs und ihre Abhängigkeit zu verstehen (Paid und Organic) sowie das Verständnis, Erkenntnis in ansprechende und verständliche Darstellungen zu übertragen
Durch dein Verständnis für Prozesse der Social Media Datenerhebung und Darstellung bereicherst du das gesamte Team (Benchmarking, Index-Berechnung, Mittelwert, Lineare Regression, Box Plot und Skalenniveaus)


Wer wir sind

Gegründet 1981 in Hamburg, sind wir als eine der führenden Kreativ-Agenturen im deutschsprachigen Raum mittlerweile mit Standorten in Berlin, Düsseldorf, Frankfurt, Stuttgart, Zürich, Wien und Brüssel vertreten. Bei uns arbeiten rund 1.200 Kolleg*innen – wir nennen sie Friends – mit Leidenschaft und Kreativität für große und kleine Kunden aus allen Branchen.

Wie wir unsere Friendskultur leben

Alle Friends haben bei uns den Raum, sie selbst zu sein, zu lernen und zu wachsen. Du kannst innovative Ideen einbringen und groß werden lassen. Auf dich warten neue Herausforderungen und vielfältige Weiterbildungsangebote. Im Mittelpunkt stehen immer die Menschen und ein wertschätzendes Miteinander. Daher sind Vielfalt, Gleichberechtigung und Inklusion wesentlich in unserer Wertekultur und Managementstrategie. In unserer Academy und mit unseren Angeboten setzen wir auf Mental Health, Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf sowie einen großen Fokus auf Diversity-Impulse in Unconscious-Bias-Workshops, in Vorträgen oder innerhalb verschiedener Mitarbeitendennetzwerke (ERGs).

Was es oben drauf gibt


Wir ermöglichen ein hybrides Arbeitsmodell (zwei Office-Tage) und flexible Arbeitszeiten
Arbeiten aus dem EU-Ausland | bis zu 45 Tage
Discounts bei Dienstleistern und Fitnessstudios im Umkreis unserer Standorte
Vergünstigter Paketpreis von "Wellhub" für Sport-, Freizeit-, Wellness- oder App-Angebote
Möglichkeit der Mitgestaltung der Agenturkultur durch Round Tables und Mitarbeitendeninitiativen, wie z. B. unserer &Queer*-Community
Scholz & Friends Academy: offene Weiterbildungsangebote zu Fachthemen, Impulsgebungen, Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging (D.E.I.B.) und vielem mehr
Mental-Health-Support in Kooperation mit unseren Partner*innen von Telus Health: u.a. Videositzungen mit Therapeut*innen und Psycholog*innen, zur Förderung der individuellen mentalen Gesundheit
Eltern-Kind-Service zur Förderung des familienfreundlichen Klimas am Arbeitsplatz und eine gesunde Work-Life-Balance mit unseren Partner*innen von voiio


Weitere Benefits an deinem Standort erfährst du im persönlichen Gespräch!

Verrate uns gerne, wie du angesprochen werden möchtest (Wunschname und Pronomen). Dann können wir dies im gesamten Prozess berücksichtigen.

 

Du willst vor deiner Bewerbung noch ein wenig mehr über uns erfahren oder hast Fragen zu Barrierefreiheit bei Scholz & Friends? Kein Problem! Schreib uns einfach eine Mail unter jobs@s-f.com. Wir freuen uns auf dich!

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Location: Onsite. Berlin Mitte, Germany.

About Us

Founded in 2021, our company operates a pioneering marketplace that redefines one of the largest supply chains in the world from out of the heart of Berlin. Our mission is to unlock the vast potential of cross-border supply for the Western Market by providing global access to high-quality products through our innovative platform.

Since our launch in January 2022, we have operated discreetly, successfully serving hundreds of companies without a public profile or media coverage. We cater to both major industry players and mid-sized companies, utilizing a cutting-edge technology platform that is experiencing rapid growth. Having secured substantial capital from top-tier VCs, Unicorn and Decacorn founders, and industry experts through various funding rounds, we are well-funded, 50 people strong, and expanding our team!

About This Role

We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team in the heart of Berlin. In this pivotal role, you will define and execute our data modeling and analysis strategy, drive data governance and quality assurance excellence, take the lead in tool and system innovation, and introduce best practices and mentoring.

You will work closely with business intelligence professionals, senior engineers, data analysts, and business stakeholders from sales, procurement, and accounting to develop features that drive business growth.

Tasks

What You Will Do


Lead the development and maintenance of the company’s BI structure to support strategic business initiatives
Conduct complex data analysis to extract deep insights and trends that drive business growth and operational efficiency
Create advanced dashboards, reports, and visualizations that facilitate data-driven decision-making at all levels of the organization
Act as a strategic partner to senior management and department heads, understanding their data needs and delivering actionable intelligence
Translate high-level business requirements into detailed technical specifications for robust data reporting and analysis
Facilitate data-driven discussions and workshops with stakeholders to enhance organizational data literacy
Ensure the accuracy, consistency, and integrity of data across the organization
Develop and implement comprehensive data validation and cleansing processes to maintain the highest data quality standards
Lead the continuous improvement and optimization of the BI infrastructure and reporting capabilities using advanced BI tools and platforms (such as Tableau, Power BI, SQL, and Databricks)
Mentor and develop junior analysts, fostering a culture of continuous learning and professional growth within the team



Requirements

What you bring


Master’s degree in Business, Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field. A Master’s degree is strongly preferred.
5+ years of extensive experience in business intelligence, data analysis, and reporting.
Proven track record of delivering strategic insights and high-quality reports in a fast-paced environment.
Advanced proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau/Power BI, SQL and Google Sheets
Experience with data warehousing, ETL processes, and real-time data processing frameworks



Who You Are


Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex datasets and translate them into actionable business insights
Excellent communication skills with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders
Strong ability to present data insights and strategic recommendations to diverse audiences, including senior leadership
High level of attention to detail and accuracy in data analysis and reporting
Ability to ensure data quality and integrity in all analytical processes
Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and drive results in a rapidly evolving organization



Benefits

What we offer


A role with entrepreneurial freedom in a pre-validated business model, to push to the next level
An experienced founding team of serial founders
A future-proof job with an attractive salary
Collaboration with top-tier investors and angles (incl. various unicorn founders) as well as leading market experts
A challenging yet rewarding work environment, and the opportunity to make a significant impact within a rapidly growing company
Beautiful office space in the center of Berlin, monthly All-Hands, team events, and team lunches



Join one of the fastest-growing B2B companies in Europe, led by an international, intercultural team of serial entrepreneurs, and experienced executives!

Internal job reference: 7b906e50-fcaa-4972-90c8-418ed163b669
Show more

Benefits

What we offer

  • A role with entrepreneurial freedom in a pre-validated business model, to push to the next level
  • An experienced founding team of serial founders
  • A future-proof job with an attractive salary
  • Collaboration with top-tier investors and angles (incl. various unicorn founders) as well as leading market experts
  • A challenging yet rewarding work environment, and the opportunity to make a significant impact within a rapidly growing company
  • Beautiful office space in the center of Berlin, monthly All-Hands, team events, and team lunches


Join one of the fastest-growing B2B companies in Europe, led by an international, intercultural team of serial entrepreneurs, and experienced executives!

Internal job reference: 7b906e50-fcaa-4972-90c8-418ed163b669

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
At Digital Turbine, we make mobile advertising experiences more meaningful and rewarding for users, app publishers, and advertisers — intelligently connecting people in more ways, across more devices. We provide app publishers and advertisers with powerful ads and experiences that captivate consumers, fuel performance, and help telecoms and OEMs supercharge awareness, acquisition, and monetization. In a rapidly evolving industry, we are constantly innovating and creating better paths of discovery to connect consumers, publishers, and advertisers across the mobile ecosystem.

About the Role:


Create highly scalable and fault tolerant technical designs working with team members (up to 5 people).
Develop and implement data pipelines that extracts, transforms and loads data into an information product that helps to inform the organization in reaching strategic goals.
Write high-quality code, conduct and participate in code reviews, and follow strong engineering principles and standards.
Research the technical feasibility of new ideas and actively suggest technology improvements.
Quickly develop a thorough understanding of the product, architecting the system and shipping production ready code.
Write maintainable code that can scale fast.
Support and contribute to our amazing work culture.


About You:


Deep experience & understanding of object-oriented design, design patterns, micro services architecture, data structure, algorithms and their complexities, and systems architecture
Skilled in writing and automating tests for your code
Proven working experience with cloud platforms.
Demonstrated experience with OLTP databases, specifically MySQL (understanding of day to day challenges related to query execution and optimization, e.g. indexing and cascading)
Working experience with big data aggregation frameworks (Spark)
Experience with streaming platforms like kafka and rabbitMQ
Experience working in an agile environment
Experience with C++ or any front-end framework is a plus
Excellent spoken and written communication skills in English


Big Data Skills:


3+ years of experience with writing code in Scala
Experience with Python, Spark, Airflow
Experience with Scala testing frameworks
Understanding of data-warehousing and data-modeling techniques
Proven experience with writing code for spark data processing
Familiarity with various OLAP data stores (Druid, Clickhouse etc) and their insights
Experience with at least one columnar OLAP databases
Familiarity with industry-standard analytics and visualization tools

Title: Financial Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
Deine Aufgaben


Du entwickelst eine neue Prozessmodellierung für Finanzdaten und baust sie auf
Dabei erstellst du neue Dashboards und Auswertungen zur Datenanalyse und visualisierst Trends
Du bringst dein Erfahrungswissen bei Entscheidungsgrundlagen für das Management ein und bereitest diese vor
Du wirkst aktiv bei der Implementierung neuer Applikationen und Tools mit und bist für die erforderliche Anpassung von Geschäftsprozessen mitverantwortlich
Deine Expertise bringst du proaktiv bei der Aufbereitung verschiedener finanzrelevanter Projekte ein
In direkter Berichtslinie arbeitest du eng mit unserem Vice President Finance & Admin zusammen


Dein Profil


Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Studium in einem wirtschaftswissenschaftlichen Bereich vorzugsweise mit dem Schwerpunkt Finanzen, oder eine abgeschlossene, kaufmännische Ausbildung
Du bist erfahren in der Erstellung von Reports und Präsentationen (mittels BI Tools und MS Office)
Deine Argumentationssicherheit basiert auf Zahlen, Daten & Fakten
Du bist eine eigenständige und selbstorganisierte Arbeitsweise gewohnt, dabei aber ein Teamplayer
Du bringst Passion und Freude an der Analyse und Auswertung von Daten und digitalen Lösungen mit
Du verfügst über Kommunikationsstärke und eine Ausgeprägte Service- und Kundenorientierung
Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse


Freu Dich Drauf


Zukunftsweisende Technologien für den Alltag entwickeln
Spannende Projekte und vielfältige Aufgabenfelder mit großer Wirkung
Gestaltungsfreiraum und Eigenverantwortung bei der Entwicklung von Qualitätsprodukten zum Anfassen
Flexibles Arbeiten mit der Option, mehrere Tage pro Woche im Homeoffice zu arbeiten
44 Euro Beitrag zum Deutschlandticket
Vermögenswirksame Leistungen in Höhe von 27 Euro pro Monat
30 Tage Urlaub sowie Heiligabend und Silvester frei
Individuelle Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und eine offene Voneinander-Lern-Kultur wie z.B. im Rahmen unserer Developer Coffee Breaks
Einzigartige Teamevents, z.B. Grillevents, Weihnachtsfeier und das große AVM Sommerfest, zu dem auch deine Familie miteingeladen ist
Show more

Title: Senior People Data Analyst
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

We are looking for a Senior Analyst to join our People Analytics Team. As Vinted grows with new products, locations and increasing complexity there is a need to further support decision making in the company with people data.

As a Senior Analyst your primary focus will be on analyzing and interpreting data across the employee lifecycle providing a holistic view from candidacy to alumni. You will have an opportunity to build People analytics products from scratch and shape the People Analytics function at Vinted. We’re looking for a special candidate that has a combination of HR domain expertise, strong knowledge of analysis tools and the ability to communicate well with a variety of stakeholders.

Reporting to People Analytics Lead you will work within a team whose mandate is to accelerate people analytics at Vinted. You will work with data across various People systems like Workday, Greenhouse, Peakon and others.

In this position, you’ll


Contribute to building People Analytics products and expansion of data-based culture
Understand business problems and enable business leaders and the People team to translate them into solutions supported by data and analysis
Managing dashboards, analysis and enabling for data spanning across the complete Employee Life Cycle (“From Hire to Retire”)
Contribute to cross-functional projects and initiatives in People team


About You


BSc or MSc in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, or another related field (or equivalent working experience)
HR domain expertise
Strong analytical, strategic, and storytelling skills
Experience with data visualization tools, preferably Looker but Tableau and Power Bi are applicable too
You are a Google Sheets master
Excellent communication and relationships building skills to partner with stakeholders
Ability to prioritize and manage time effectively
Knowledge of Workday reporting would be an advantage


Nice-to-have:


Hands-on experience in statistics and advanced analysis, i.e. hypothesis testing, forecasting, predictions, sentiment analysis, etc.
Knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (R, Python, Matlab etc.)
Ability to use SQL
App scripting in Google Sheets


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You’ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is € 68,000 - € 92,000 gross per year.

Title: Senior People Data Analyst
Description:
We believe it takes great people to create a great product. That’s why our team lives our company values, and we hire based on them, too. Since 2010, Pipedrive has been on a mission to support sales and marketing teams with easy-to-use, powerful tools that make everyday work faster and easier. Today, our cloud-based software is trusted by over 100,000 companies and used in 179 countries. We have grown from a five-person team to a truly international company of over 850+ people, representing more than 50 nationalities, with ten offices distributed across Europe and the US. In 2020, Pipedrive received a majority investment from Vista Equity Partners, a global investment firm that invests exclusively in enterprise software, data and technology-enabled businesses, making Pipedrive the fifth unicorn from Estonia.

We are looking for a senior people data analyst to join our talented analytics team. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis and data visualisation to support and influence key business initiatives. Your insights will directly contribute to optimising our operations and will help guide strategic decisions across the organisation.

Your new adventure:


Gather and analyze data from various P&C systems and sources, including HRIS, ATS, performance management tools, employee surveys, and external benchmarks
Identify current industry trends and patterns within People data to provide insights into areas such as recruitment, talent management, workforce demographics, turnover rates, performance metrics, and employee engagement and proactively identify opportunities to enhance the organization’s analytical capabilities
Develop and maintain key People metrics and dashboards to track progress and identify areas for improvement. Present findings and recommendations through clear and compelling data visualizations and presentations
Provide data-driven recommendations to senior leadership and other stakeholders to inform strategic decisions related to human resources and organizational development
Collaborate with P&C business partners and other stakeholders to understand business needs and develop solutions that optimize the employee experience and drive organizational success
Lead or participate in special projects and initiatives related to HR analytics, such as predictive modelling, workforce planning, and diversity and inclusion initiatives
Mentor and provide guidance to junior members of the HR analytics team, fostering a culture of continuous learning and development
Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and ethical standards when handling sensitive HR data, maintaining confidentiality and data security at all times.


Does this sound like you?


4+ years of experience as an analyst with a focus on HR projects
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Experience working with data visualisation tools such as Tableau or Power BI
Ability to create and present data-driven stories to different stakeholders
Good understanding of SQL and Python is a plus


Why Pipedrive:


A value-driven work environment where people come first
A lively bunch of colleagues from over 50 different countries, with offices in Tallinn, Tartu, Lisbon, Prague, London, Dublin, New York, Florida, Riga and Berlin
A team serious about getting things done while not taking ourselves too seriously
A world-class working environment full of perks like parties, snacks, and drinks like Spezi and Club-Mate, and, of course, office dogs
Flexible working hours as long as you’re there for your team members
Freedom to execute your ideas with a passionate and motivated team supporting you
Lots of room for personal and career development, with internal and external training opportunities
Competitive salary and bonus system and all the benefits you’d expect from a great employer (health coverage, transportation allowance, language courses, in-house coaches, employee discounts, and more)


Pipedrive is an equal-opportunity employer. We encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of age, gender, race, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or veteran status.

We're on the looking for a senior people data analyst to join our team in Berlin.

If this is something for you, send us your resume (in English) or a link to your LinkedIn profile and please add why we should pay extra attention to your application.


Show more

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
The role in a Snapshot

Are you passionate about disrupting the future of education and to make a real impact? Do you want a career in an edtech company that is innovative and rewarding? Join us and enjoy working alongside an international team of talented thinkers, doers and magic makers.

We are seeking a passionate and experienced Marketing Data Analyst to join our central Data Team. You will play a key role in developing and maintaining our BI infrastructure, overseeing data governance as well as driving actionable insights and making direct impact on efficiency of marketing expenditures.

Location

Remote within Austria, Germany, and Spain. Hybrid is also possible in Vienna, Berlin, and Madrid.

Your Role in Our Journey


Partner closely with Marketing leaders and stakeholders to shape the marketing strategy through data-driven insights and impactful analysis.
Provide and present reports that are actionable for business departments and support the decision making process.
Work closely with Data Analysts and Data Engineers, support and mentor colleagues within Data & business teams to build, maintain and improve the set of current dashboards applying best Business Intelligence practices.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, refine, organize and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) that align with business objectives.
Design and develop Data Models that empowers end users to answer their own questions.
Drive adaptation of new tools & technologies in BI area to maintain a clean, accurate, and efficient data governance framework.


Your impact


3+ years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst / Data Analyst or related role.
Strong Marketing analytics background, with proven experience in digital marketing projects. Experience in attribution modeling is a plus.
Proven proficiency in SQL, with strong experience in building clean and meaningful tables.
Expert-level knowledge of Tableau with outstanding data storytelling skills.
Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, data governance principles, and ETL processes. Experience with DBT and Amazon Web Services or other cloud computer platforms is a plus.
Strong problem solving, analytical thinking and organizational qualities.
Strong communication skills, and ability to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels.


Your way to unlock your full potential


Disrupting Education: Join us for a unique opportunity to disrupt the traditional education landscape. It's not just a job; it's a chance to be part of something big and meaningful.
Global Dream Team: Say hello to an international and diverse crew of thinkers, doers, and magic makers. Get ready to be inspired daily by your colleagues from around the world.
Work, Your Way: We offer a flexible, hybrid work environment that respects your need for work-life harmony with 2/3 remote days a week & 5 fully remote weeks a year so you can shine in a way that suits you best.
Office Shenanigans: Our regular team and office events will keep your spirits high. We believe in bonding, celebrating, and having a blast together.
Strength in Unity: Join one of our GoStudent Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) and be part of communities that champion causes you're passionate about.
Growing is LIT: The sky's the limit in our EdTech playground. Access a wide array of online and in-person learning and development opportunities to build your career as high as your dreams can take you.
Support Around the Clock: We've got your back 24/7. Enjoy a comprehensive Employee Support Programme that's not just for you but for your loved ones too.


Life at GoStudent:

Do you want to reimagine education together with us and join a mission to believe in?

GoStudent is one of the world’s leading tutoring providers and education platforms. We’re also a unicorn and have raised more than €675m investment to date. Together with our acquisitions Seneca Learning, Tus Media and Studienkreis, we currently support more than 11 million families each month to fulfil our vision to help each student reach their full potential.

We are passionate about disrupting the future of education and making a real impact. Join our journey and unlock your creativity and advance your career by mastering exciting challenges together with an international, driven team. We are here to support your goals and to discover how far we can reach by growing smarter and stronger together. If this sounds good to you, then join us now and unlock your full potential.

Openness Statement

At GoStudent, we are an open and welcoming bunch that values your unique skills, passion, and potential. We don't hire based on age, gender, nationality, or political views, but rather focus on your talent and motivation to contribute to the future of learning. Even if you are a unicorn - just as GoStudent is: if you believe that you can make a positive impact, we encourage you to throw your hat in the ring & to apply, regardless of whether you meet every requirement. Our team is diverse, and we believe that this diversity fosters creativity and innovation, making us a better company. Join us in reimagining the future of learning!

Learn more about "Who we are"

Please upload your CV/Resume in PDF format, preferably in English, as a DOC format might not be supported.

Disclose Privacy & Compliance Information
Show more

Are you passionate about disrupting the future of education and to make a real impact? Do you want a career in an edtech company that is innovative and rewarding? Join us and enjoy working alongside an international team of talented thinkers, doers and magic makers.

We are seeking a passionate and experienced Marketing Data Analyst to join our central Data Team. You will play a key role in developing and maintaining our BI infrastructure, overseeing data governance as well as driving actionable insights and making direct impact on efficiency of marketing expenditures.

Location

Remote within Austria, Germany, and Spain. Hybrid is also possible in Vienna, Berlin, and Madrid.

Your Role in Our Journey

  • Partner closely with Marketing leaders and stakeholders to shape the marketing strategy through data-driven insights and impactful analysis.
  • Provide and present reports that are actionable for business departments and support the decision making process.
  • Work closely with Data Analysts and Data Engineers, support and mentor colleagues within Data & business teams to build, maintain and improve the set of current dashboards applying best Business Intelligence practices.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, refine, organize and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) that align with business objectives.
  • Design and develop Data Models that empowers end users to answer their own questions.
  • Drive adaptation of new tools & technologies in BI area to maintain a clean, accurate, and efficient data governance framework.

Your impact

  • 3+ years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst / Data Analyst or related role.
  • Strong Marketing analytics background, with proven experience in digital marketing projects. Experience in attribution modeling is a plus.
  • Proven proficiency in SQL, with strong experience in building clean and meaningful tables.
  • Expert-level knowledge of Tableau with outstanding data storytelling skills.
  • Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, data governance principles, and ETL processes. Experience with DBT and Amazon Web Services or other cloud computer platforms is a plus.
  • Strong problem solving, analytical thinking and organizational qualities.
  • Strong communication skills, and ability to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels.

Your way to unlock your full potential

  • Disrupting Education: Join us for a unique opportunity to disrupt the traditional education landscape. It's not just a job; it's a chance to be part of something big and meaningful.
  • Global Dream Team: Say hello to an international and diverse crew of thinkers, doers, and magic makers. Get ready to be inspired daily by your colleagues from around the world.
  • Work, Your Way: We offer a flexible, hybrid work environment that respects your need for work-life harmony with 2/3 remote days a week & 5 fully remote weeks a year so you can shine in a way that suits you best.
  • Office Shenanigans: Our regular team and office events will keep your spirits high. We believe in bonding, celebrating, and having a blast together.
  • Strength in Unity: Join one of our GoStudent Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) and be part of communities that champion causes you're passionate about.
  • Growing is LIT: The sky's the limit in our EdTech playground. Access a wide array of online and in-person learning and development opportunities to build your career as high as your dreams can take you.
  • Support Around the Clock: We've got your back 24/7. Enjoy a comprehensive Employee Support Programme that's not just for you but for your loved ones too.

Life at GoStudent:

Do you want to reimagine education together with us and join a mission to believe in?

GoStudent is one of the world’s leading tutoring providers and education platforms. We’re also a unicorn and have raised more than €675m investment to date. Together with our acquisitions Seneca Learning, Tus Media and Studienkreis, we currently support more than 11 million families each month to fulfil our vision to help each student reach their full potential.

We are passionate about disrupting the future of education and making a real impact. Join our journey and unlock your creativity and advance your career by mastering exciting challenges together with an international, driven team. We are here to support your goals and to discover how far we can reach by growing smarter and stronger together. If this sounds good to you, then join us now and unlock your full potential.

Openness Statement

At GoStudent, we are an open and welcoming bunch that values your unique skills, passion, and potential. We don't hire based on age, gender, nationality, or political views, but rather focus on your talent and motivation to contribute to the future of learning. Even if you are a unicorn - just as GoStudent is: if you believe that you can make a positive impact, we encourage you to throw your hat in the ring & to apply, regardless of whether you meet every requirement. Our team is diverse, and we believe that this diversity fosters creativity and innovation, making us a better company. Join us in reimagining the future of learning!

Learn more about "Who we are"

Please upload your CV/Resume in PDF format, preferably in English, as a DOC format might not be supported.

Disclose Privacy & Compliance Information

Title: Data Analyst - Goal:100 (d/m/w)
Description:
FÜR EIN NEUES GESELLSCHAFTLICHES ZUSAMMENWIRKEN: WERDE TEIL VON PROJECTTOGETHER

Hast du Lust, mit Goal100 die Energiewende zu beschleunigen? Bist du begeistert von Windenergie? Hast du Erfahrung im Bereich Data Analytics? Dann bist du bei uns genau richtig!

Bei Goal100 arbeiten wir gemeinsam mit verschiedenen Partner:innen daran, den Ausbau der Windkraft an Land voranzutreiben. Unser Projekt wurde von einer engagierten Gruppe von Gründer:innen, Digitalexperten, Medienschaffenden, Wissenschaftler:innen und Aktivist:innen ins Leben gerufen. Goal100 wird von Google.org mitfinanziert und von ProjectTogether geführt und gehostet. Mach mit und gestalte die Zukunft der Energiewende aktiv mit!

Das erwartet dich

Bei Goal100 erwartet dich ein dynamisches Umfeld, in dem wir fest an die transformative Kraft von Daten und Teamarbeit glauben. Unsere Arbeit dreht sich um den Umgang mit Daten, in denen wir den Schlüssel für Veränderung sehen - und für Beschleunigung. Wir setzen auf die Beteiligung aller Akteure, um gemeinsam Großes zu erreichen.

In dieser Position beschäftigst du dich mit verschiedenen Datenquellen, vom Auslesen, über Cleansing bis zur Auswertung und Interpretation. Auch Aufgaben aus dem Bereich Data Engineering können in Frage kommen.

Unsere Positionen sind flexibel gestaltet und orientieren sich stark an den individuellen Stärken und Interessen unserer Teammitglieder. Flexibilität und Offenheit für neue Themen und Verantwortlichkeiten sind daher bei uns sehr willkommen, ebenso wie die Bereitschaft, neue Fähigkeiten zu entwickeln. Wir als Team und als Organisation unterstützen und fördern aktiv den Willen, Verantwortung zu übernehmen und Neues zu lernen.

Dein Profil

Wir suchen ein motiviertes und flexibles Teammitglied, das Freude am Lösen komplexer Probleme hat.


Mindestens 2 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Data Analytics: Du kannst eigenständig Datenbanken auslesen, große Datenmengen auswerten, diese visualisieren, und Insights daraus ableiten
Du bist vertraut mit der Verarbeitung und Bereinigung von (un-)strukturierten Daten und kannst Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen in ein gemeinsames tabellarisches Format konsolidieren
Du hast fundierte Python-Kenntnisse, Erfahrung im Umgang mit Paketen wie pandas, numpy, matplotlib und kannst deinen Code in ausführbare Skripte umwandeln. Du nutzt GitHub zur gemeinsamen Kollaboration und Versionskontrolle
Du hast einen gut bis sicheren Umgang mit relationalen Datenbanken (PostgreSQL) und SQL und bist bewandert in der Nutzung von Python-Bibliotheken zur Interaktion mit Datenbanken (SQLAlchemy, Psycopg2)
Die Ergebnisse deiner datengetriebenen Analysen stellst du in anschaulichen und verständlichen Visualisierungen dar (bspw. in Python oder Tableau), sodass komplexe Zusammenhänge, Trends und spannende Insights entnommen werden können.
Du hast Spaß daran, deine Arbeit im Team vorzustellen und deine Erkenntnisse gemeinsam weiterzuentwickeln
Vorteilhaft ist es, wenn Du Dich mit der Nutzung von Workflow-Orchestration Tools (prefect, Airflow), Container-Software zur Reproduzierbarkeit und Migration von Pipeline-Systemen und Cloud-Strukturen zum Hosten von Daten-Pipelines auskennst und grundlegende Methoden des Software-Engineering wie Code-Refactoring, Packaging und Objekt-orientiertes Programmieren anzuwenden weist


Hast Du bereits Erfahrungen im Bereich Erneuerbare Energien im Allgemeinen oder Windkraft im Speziellen gesammelt? Oder Kenntnisse in der Handhabung von Geodaten? Umso besser! Von Vorteil sind außerdem Kenntnisse im Bereich Umwelt- und Raumplanung. Wenn nicht, mach' dir keine Sorgen und bewirb dich trotzdem.

Was wir Dir bieten


Gehalt nach einem transparenten und gemeinschaftlich entwickelten Gehaltsmodell
Ein motiviertes, extrem engagiertes Team
Hohe Flexibilität - Home-Office ebenso möglich wie regelmäßige Arbeit im ProjectTogether Office in Berlin-Mitte
Persönliche Weiterentwicklung als integrales Ziel deiner Arbeit, das durch individuelle Betreuung und dedizierte Weiterbildungszeit- und budget unterstützt wird
30 Urlaubstage
Finanzielle Unterstützung bei Deiner betrieblichen Altersvorsorge
Zuschuss zu Deiner Urban Sports-Mitgliedschaft und die Mitgliedschaft bei nilo.health – eine Plattform, um Deine mentale Gesundheit am Arbeitsplatz zu stärken.
Zusammenarbeit in einem freundlichen Team mit ehrlicher Feedback- und Development-Kultur, das sich leidenschaftlich für die Energiewende einsetzt


So geht es weiter

Möchtest Du Teil unseres Teams werden? Dann schick uns Deinen Lebenslauf und ein Anschreiben, in dem Du uns erzählst, warum Du gut zu Goal100 passt! Wir sind gespannt, Dich kennenzulernen! Wir freuen uns über Bewerbungen aller fachlichen Hintergründe.

Diversität im Team sehen wir als Grundlage für diskriminierungsbewusstes Handeln und Impact. Wir begrüßen daher ausdrücklich Bewerbungen von strukturell diskriminierten Personen.

Über uns

Für ein neues gesellschaftliches Zusammenwirken: Werde Teil von ProjectTogether!

Von der Schülerinitiative zur gemeinnützigen Organisation für Collective Action – das ist ProjectTogether. Wir bringen Gesellschaft, Politik und Wirtschaft ins gemeinsame Handeln und treiben Transformation voran.
Show more

Title: Data Analysis Lead (m/f/d)
Description:
Everything we do, starts with you. Together with you, we build the most human-centric fintech. To enable everyone’s future financial growth.




We are looking for a

Data Analysis Lead (m/f/d)

(unlimited, fulltime) Join our team at our location in Verl, Berlin, Baden-Baden, Oslo or Heerenveen – flexible working conditions available




As the Data Analysis Lead, you will guide our international team of data analysts across the Nordics, Benelux, and DACH regions. You will play a crucial role in advancing our data strategy and developing our team to meet their professional growth goals. Collaborating closely with various business and functional units, you will translate business needs into data experiments and derive actionable insights about our consumers, clients, and business processes.







Your responsibilities:

Lead, mentor, and manage an international team of data analysts within the fintech domain
Foster a collaborative and high-performance team environment, promoting continuous improvement and innovation
Conduct complex data analyses and provide actionable insights to support business goals and strategic initiatives
Ensure accuracy, integrity, and timeliness of all analytical deliverables, maintaining high data quality standards
Develop and maintain analysis and visualizations to effectively communicate findings to stakeholders using data storytelling techniques
Oversee the planning, execution, and completion of data analysis projects, ensuring alignment with business objectives and deadlines
Collaborate with stakeholders from various business units (e.g., BNPL, collections) and functional units (e.g., Finance, Marketing, Risk Management) to understand data needs and deliver insights
Provide decision support to business units, aiding in informed, data-driven decision-making
Standardize data analysis methodologies, implementing best practices to ensure consistency across the team
Contribute to data governance and strategy initiatives, supporting the organization’s data management and strategic goals




What you should bring:

5+ years of data analysis experience, including 2 years in a leadership role
Master’s/MBA degree in a numerate subject (e.g., Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics)
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (Databricks, SQL, Python)
Excellent analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy, able to identify issues and conduct necessary analysis
Exceptional interpersonal and leadership skills, with a passion for enabling team growth
Ability to balance multiple priorities, work independently, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Experience in the financial industry, especially in Debt Collection and Buy Now, Pay Later
Working experience in an agile, cross-functional organizational setup
Team player, hands-on mentality, and result-oriented







Thrive at Riverty with great benefits:

Enjoy an open, trusting culture in agile teams and access opportunities within the Bertelsmann Group.
Prioritize your health with supported sports and leisure activities.
Grow together through Riverty Academy trainings and personalized development.
Feel valued with numerous employee discounts.
Our flexible working arrangements empower you to blend on-site collaboration with remote work, tailoring your professional experience to suit your lifestyle.

This list doesn't assure any certain benefits or actions. They might depend on the country or contract details and can change anytime without prior notice. We are happy to discuss these benefits further during your interview.




About us

We are Riverty. And we believe everyone should be in control of their financials. We ask you to join in. Because together with you, we build the most human-centric fintech. We build on experience of more than 50 years. More than 5,000 people in 13 countries drive our company and contribution to society. And we have their backs. We make sure they feel supported and included: Across teams, across physical and invisible borders and across the globe.




Our world is growing. And we’re here. Together, we’re finding smarter, simpler, seamlessly connected ways to manage money. By leveraging data and financial technology, our holistic solutions provide flexible payments, smarter accounting, and fair debt collection, all aimed at fostering everyone's financial growth.




And. Everything we do, starts with you. Join us and let‘s build a more sustainable financial future, together.




More information on riverty.com/careers. Are you already convinced? Then we look forward to receiving your online application – with just a few clicks.

We look forward to applications from candidates who contribute to the diversity of our company. We relate diversity in particular to the dimensions of cultural or social origin, religion, age, disability, gender and sexual identity.




Company: Riverty Group GmbH

Country: Germany

State/Region: Berlin

City: Europe multi-location

Postal Code: 10623

Job ID: 271863

By leveraging data and financial technology, our holistic solutions provide flexible payments, smarter accounting, and fair debt collection, all aimed at fostering everyone's financial growth.

Title: (Junior) Consultant Data Analytics (m/w/d)
Description:
Deine Benefits
Corporate Benefits: Dazu zählen beispielsweise WellYou Gesundheitsbudget, JobRad-Leasing oder Firmenfitness mit EGYM Wellpass
Flexibles Arbeiten: Deine Pläne sind so individuell wie du selbst: Wähle deinen Arbeitsort flexibel – ob beim Kunden, in einer unserer Office Locations oder remote
Mentorship: Erfahrene Kolleg:innen stehen dir bei deinem Start und deiner Entwicklung zur Seite
Persönliche Weiterentwicklung: Dich erwarten vielfältige Karriereperspektiven in einem unbefristeten Arbeitsvertrag sowie individuelle Förderung durch ein umfangreiches Trainings- und Coachingangebot
Teamspirit: Bei uns werden flache Hierarchien und eine teamorientierte Unternehmenskultur gelebt – darüber hinaus sind ökologische Verantwortung und gesellschaftliches Engagement Teil unserer DNA
Vertrauensurlaub: Unser innovatives Konzept ermöglicht es dir, deine Erholungszeiten in Abstimmung mit deinem Team eigenverantwortlich und selbstbestimmt festzulegen
Vergütungsmodell: Du profitierst von unserem attraktiven Modell inklusive eines erfolgsabhängigen Bonus
Work-Life-Choice: Wir bieten dir hierzu umfangreiche Angebote – dazu zählen u. a. Sabbaticals oder Workation




Deine zukünftigen Aufgaben

Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir dich als (Junior) Consultant Data Analytics (m/w/d) an den Standorten Berlin, Düsseldorf, Frankfurt am Main, Hamburg, Leipzig, München, Stuttgart und Walldorf.

Unsere Kunden digitalisieren kontinuierlich ihre Reporting-Prozesse und Data Analytics Landschaft. Gemeinsam mit unserem erfahrenen Team unterstützt du beim Aufbau von innovativen Reporting & Analytics-Systemen, Data Analytics Plattformen oder Data Management Konzepten. In den Bereichen Automotive, Mobility, Maschinen- & Anlagenbau, Logistik & Distribution, Konsumgüter & Handel, Chemie und Pharma gestaltest du mit unseren Kunden die digitale Zukunft:

Du bearbeitest spannende Consulting-Themen wie Analytics-Strategie, oder die Konzeption und Realisierung von State-of-the Art Cloud-, AI- oder Analytics-Applikationen
Du berätst unsere Kunden bei der Einführung von Data Mesh, Data Fabric, Data Virtualization oder Datenkatalogen
Du lernst in einem sehr erfahrenen Team modernste Data Analytics Produkte wie AZURE, AWS, Snowflake, Databricks, SAP Datasphere oder Google Cloud Platform zu implementieren
Du entwickelst Management Dashboards in Power BI, Tableau, Qlik oder SAP Analytics Cloud

Dein Profil
Dein Studium der Wirtschaftswissenschaften, des Wirtschaftsingenieurwesens, der Wirtschaftsinformatik oder ähnlichem hast du erfolgreich absolviert
Du konntest bereits erste praktische Erfahrungen im Bereich  Data Analytics, Data Warehousing, ETL Prozessen (SQL) oder Datenmodellierung sammeln
Idealerweise verfügst du schon über Branchenerfahrung in den Industrien Automotive, Mobility, Maschinen- und Anlagenbau, Logistik & Distribution, Konsumgüterindustrie & Handel oder Chemie & Pharma
Um unsere Kunden vor Ort optimal zu beraten, bist du bist bereit, national und international zu reisen
Sehr gute deutsche und englische Sprachkenntnisse runden dein Profil ab




Together, we are more than Business

BearingPoint ist eine unabhängige Management- und Technologieberatung mit europäischen Wurzeln und globaler Reichweite. Wir bieten Beratung, die Strategie mit Technologie vereint und verbinden Unternehmertum mit Innovationsgeist.
Du machst den Unterschied: Wir geben dir den Raum, du selbst zu sein und dein volles Potenzial zu entfalten. Unabhängig davon, woher du kommst, woran du glaubst oder wen du liebst. Wir stehen ein für Chancengleichheit und Vielfalt. Denn wir sind überzeugt, dass erst Facettenreichtum zu einem starken Miteinander, originellen Ideen und echter Innovation führt. Deshalb sind unsere Teams bunt. Und sie dürfen bunter werden. Perspektivenwechsel statt Stagnation – moving forward mit BearingPoint. Zeig, wer du bist, und engagiere dich als Teil des Teams in einer unserer internen Initiativen: Women@BearingPoint, Proud@BearingPoint, Ability@BearingPoint & More@BearingPoint.

Show more
HTML:
Deine Benefits
  • Corporate Benefits: Dazu zählen beispielsweise WellYou Gesundheitsbudget, JobRad-Leasing oder Firmenfitness mit EGYM Wellpass
  • Flexibles Arbeiten: Deine Pläne sind so individuell wie du selbst: Wähle deinen Arbeitsort flexibel – ob beim Kunden, in einer unserer Office Locations oder remote
  • Mentorship: Erfahrene Kolleg:innen stehen dir bei deinem Start und deiner Entwicklung zur Seite
  • Persönliche Weiterentwicklung: Dich erwarten vielfältige Karriereperspektiven in einem unbefristeten Arbeitsvertrag sowie individuelle Förderung durch ein umfangreiches Trainings- und Coachingangebot
  • Teamspirit: Bei uns werden flache Hierarchien und eine teamorientierte Unternehmenskultur gelebt – darüber hinaus sind ökologische Verantwortung und gesellschaftliches Engagement Teil unserer DNA
  • Vertrauensurlaub: Unser innovatives Konzept ermöglicht es dir, deine Erholungszeiten in Abstimmung mit deinem Team eigenverantwortlich und selbstbestimmt festzulegen
  • Vergütungsmodell: Du profitierst von unserem attraktiven Modell inklusive eines erfolgsabhängigen Bonus
  • Work-Life-Choice: Wir bieten dir hierzu umfangreiche Angebote – dazu zählen u. a. Sabbaticals oder Workation


Deine zukünftigen Aufgaben

Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir dich als (Junior) Consultant Data Analytics (m/w/d) an den Standorten Berlin, Düsseldorf, Frankfurt am Main, Hamburg, Leipzig, München, Stuttgart und Walldorf.

Unsere Kunden digitalisieren kontinuierlich ihre Reporting-Prozesse und Data Analytics Landschaft. Gemeinsam mit unserem erfahrenen Team unterstützt du beim Aufbau von innovativen Reporting & Analytics-Systemen, Data Analytics Plattformen oder Data Management Konzepten. In den Bereichen Automotive, Mobility, Maschinen- & Anlagenbau, Logistik & Distribution, Konsumgüter & Handel, Chemie und Pharma gestaltest du mit unseren Kunden die digitale Zukunft:

  • Du bearbeitest spannende Consulting-Themen wie Analytics-Strategie, oder die Konzeption und Realisierung von State-of-the Art Cloud-, AI- oder Analytics-Applikationen
  • Du berätst unsere Kunden bei der Einführung von Data Mesh, Data Fabric, Data Virtualization oder Datenkatalogen
  • Du lernst in einem sehr erfahrenen Team modernste Data Analytics Produkte wie AZURE, AWS, Snowflake, Databricks, SAP Datasphere oder Google Cloud Platform zu implementieren
  • Du entwickelst Management Dashboards in Power BI, Tableau, Qlik oder SAP Analytics Cloud

Dein Profil
  • Dein Studium der Wirtschaftswissenschaften, des Wirtschaftsingenieurwesens, der Wirtschaftsinformatik oder ähnlichem hast du erfolgreich absolviert
  • Du konntest bereits erste praktische Erfahrungen im Bereich  Data Analytics, Data Warehousing, ETL Prozessen (SQL) oder Datenmodellierung sammeln
  • Idealerweise verfügst du schon über Branchenerfahrung in den Industrien Automotive, Mobility, Maschinen- und Anlagenbau, Logistik & Distribution, Konsumgüterindustrie & Handel oder Chemie & Pharma
  • Um unsere Kunden vor Ort optimal zu beraten, bist du bist bereit, national und international zu reisen
  • Sehr gute deutsche und englische Sprachkenntnisse runden dein Profil ab


Together, we are more than Business

BearingPoint ist eine unabhängige Management- und Technologieberatung mit europäischen Wurzeln und globaler Reichweite. Wir bieten Beratung, die Strategie mit Technologie vereint und verbinden Unternehmertum mit Innovationsgeist.
Du machst den Unterschied: Wir geben dir den Raum, du selbst zu sein und dein volles Potenzial zu entfalten. Unabhängig davon, woher du kommst, woran du glaubst oder wen du liebst. Wir stehen ein für Chancengleichheit und Vielfalt. Denn wir sind überzeugt, dass erst Facettenreichtum zu einem starken Miteinander, originellen Ideen und echter Innovation führt. Deshalb sind unsere Teams bunt. Und sie dürfen bunter werden. Perspektivenwechsel statt Stagnation – moving forward mit BearingPoint. Zeig, wer du bist, und engagiere dich als Teil des Teams in einer unserer internen Initiativen: Women@BearingPoint, Proud@BearingPoint, Ability@BearingPoint & More@BearingPoint.

Title: Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Founded in 2008, BMG has become the fourth-largest music publisher worldwide. Our success and competitive edge are rooted in our founding values of fairness, transparency, and service. Our mission is clear: to empower artists and songwriters to maximize the potential of their songs and recordings in the digital era.

BMG’s Global Data Analytics is our central data unit, spanning a close-knit international team of experienced Analytics Engineers, Data Analysts and Data Scientists across Germany, the US and the UK. We’re transforming how music works, enabling operational stakeholders to make data-driven decisions as well as driving strategic growth, based on a modern data stack.

We are currently seeking an experienced Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join our headquarters in Berlin. As a seasoned Data Analyst, you will guide junior analysts and collaborate with senior stakeholders of various departments to facilitate informed decision-making through novel data insights, compelling storytelling, and advanced data visualization. Join us in shaping the future of music analytics!

 

What You’ll Be Doing


Process big data volumes, modeling and transforming data (using dbt) from centralized DWHs (e.g. Google BigQuery) and external/organizational databases to build strategic analyses and operational KPIs
Utilize data visualization to support decision-making, crafting compelling (Looker) dashboards for key business stakeholders (e.g. Investments, Artist & Repertoire, Marketing, Streaming Sales, Rights & Royalties, Finance)
Develop scalable self-service reporting solutions and address diverse ad-hoc requests that transform our business
Collaborate closely with our global team and international colleagues to foster a data-driven culture by proposing innovative initiatives and building actionable data products
Interact with developers, data engineers, and management to propose new technologies, processes and system improvements, as well as global data governance strategies
Provide training and mentorship to junior team members, empowering them to excel in their contributions to the team’s projects
Develop sustainable processes and methodologies to support the effectiveness of our Data Analytics function


What You Bring


Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
Profound experience in data analytics, ideally with large datasets
Excellent SQL skills and good knowledge of Python
Proficiency in data visualization tools, such as Looker or Tableau
Broad understanding of data analysis methods and storytelling
Results-driven and analytical character, with a strategic mindset to derive business insights
Effective communication skills - confident in presenting findings to senior management
Ability to build relationships with stakeholders to understand business needs and data consumer needs
Strong interest to mentor junior colleagues with enthusiasm and expertise
Capability to plan and implement projects independently
Comfortable working in a global, fast-paced and dynamic environment


It’s also a plus if you have…


Team leadership experience
Prior music industry experience
Experience with GCP, dbt and Git
Knowledge of Jira and Confluence
Understanding of statistical methods and ML
Experience using ETL frameworks


What We Offer


A modern office in the heart of Berlin and flexible options for remote work.
Numerous benefits such as a free BVG job ticket, a reduced-price membership for Urban Sports, company bike leasing, discounts for Bertelsmann employees, among others
Ongoing training opportunities on our internal platforms BMG Campus and Bertelsmann University
Long-term career opportunities for all employees.
A collaborative work environment with an open, appreciative community of people who all share the same passion for working with artists and songwriters.
Our unique corporate culture based on strong values and mutual support that make us a great team.


This is us

As the great Kurt Cobain once said, "Come as you are." BMG is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all employees. We value diversity in all forms. Equal opportunity is deeply rooted in our core value of fairness, and we are committed to creating a truly inclusive work environment where everyone can thrive. If you're good at what you do, come as you are! Whether you're an experienced professional or just starting out, we welcome you to join our team.

All applicants to BMG are treated equally - regardless of age, disability, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy or parenthood, ethnic origin, color, nationality, religion or belief.

(BMG is publishing Kurt Cobain's catalog, including the 1992 single 'Come As You Are.')

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.




Benefits




· Work up to 20 hours per week.

· Earn a competitive rate of pay.

· Develop your research skills.

· Avoid the long commute.

· Work from the comfort of your home office.

· Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Apply Online Today!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst / Online Marketing (m/w/d)
Description:
Wer uns fehlt, bist du!


Wir suchen dich, mit Leidenschaft für Datenanalysen und einem wachen Blick für Trends und Wettbewerb auf dem sich schnell verändernden Markt
Im Online Marketing-Team übernimmst du gekonnt diverse Analysen und Reports, welche du interpretierst und konkrete Maßnahmen für unsere Kunden ableitest
Du erarbeitest, implementierst und optimierst ein Datenschutz konformes Tracking in gängigen Tag Manager Systemen
Du visualisierst und analysierst die gesammelten Daten über gängige Webanalyse-Tools wie Google Analytics, Piwik PRO, Google BigQuery oder Google LookerStudio
Du bist in die Durchführung und Analyse von AB-Tests involviert
Du bringst ein gutes Verständnis gängiger Webtechnologien wie Javascript, HTML & CSS mit
Erfahrungen mit SQL, R, Python und anderen Programmiersprachen sind von Vorteil
Agiles Mindset? Unbedingt! Unsere Projekte finden hauptsächlich im agilen Umfeld statt und wir arbeiten dabei mit Tools wie Miro, Jira und Confluence
Du hast sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse


Unsere Benefits für dich!


Agenturgefühl und mobiles Arbeiten: leicht vereinbar durch unser hybrides Arbeitsmodell und flexible Arbeitszeiten
Workout-Life-Balance: Kooperation mit Urban Sports Club und Leasing-Angebot von JobRad
Gewinnbeteiligung: Als fester Teil von denkwerk wirst du am Gewinn beteiligt
Interne & externe Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten: Service Design Workshops und individuelle Schulungen, finanziert durch ein Weiterbildungsbudget
bAV - als denkwerker:in erhältst du einen Arbeitgeberzuschuss von 20% bei deiner betrieblichen Altersvorsorge
Freie Gerätewahl: Ob Mac oder Windows – unsere Hardware darfst du auch privat nutzen
Unterstützung in allen Lebenslagen: Beratungsmöglichkeiten des pme Familienservice
denkfrei-Tage: von unseren 31 Urlaubstagen sind drei Tage frei für alle (Heiligabend, Silvester & Rosenmontag), um gemeinsam durchzuatmen
denkmate: so nennen wir unsere erfahrenen denkwerker:innen, die dir zum Start in deinen neuen Arbeitsalltag mit Rat und Tat zur Seite stehen
Corporate Benefits: Mitarbeiterrabatte aller Art
Snacks & Drinks: kühle Limonaden, Bier, frischer Kaffee oder auch Obst und Gemüse - für jede:n ist was dabei


So geht's weiter!

Du kannst es gar nicht abwarten loszulegen? Wir auch nicht! Wir suchen dich ab sofort, sind aber auch flexibel mit deinem möglichem Startdatum.

Schicke uns bitte zusätzlich deinen CV sowie deine Gehaltsvorstellungen zu.

P. S.: klassische Anschreiben sind für dich zu normal? Überrasche uns gerne mit deiner Kreativität und stelle dich und deine Motivationen auf deine eigene Art vor. Wir sind gespannt!

Das erwartet dich im Bewerbungsprozess


1. Interview: ~1 Stunde, meist online mit zwei Teilnehmer:innen von denkwerk
2. Interview: ~1 Stunde, gerne vor Ort mit zwei Teilnehmer:innen von denkwerk
In unseren Interviews werden der fachliche wie auch menschliche denkwerk-Fit beleuchtet
Sollte eine Case Study o.Ä. auf dich zukommen, geben wir frühzeitig Bescheid
Nach den beiden Interviews folgt, bei positivem Feedback, ein telefonisches Angebotsgespräch
Unser Anspruch sind schnelle Feedback Loops: sollte dir dennoch Feedback fehlen, meld dich auch gerne proaktiv!


Warum denkwerk?

Wir sind eine inhabergeführte, digitale Agentur mit Hauptsitz in Köln Ehrenfeld und weiteren Standorten in Berlin Kreuzberg, Hamburg und München. Auf dich warten insgesamt 250 motivierte denkwerker:innen aus 28 Nationen, davon etwa 55 Kolleg:innen am Berliner Standort. Konkret wirst du Teil unseres 8 Personen starken Digital Marketing & Analytics Teams, aus dem fünf Kolleg:innen in Berlin sitzen. Als Data Analyst begleitest du spannende Kundenprojekte und arbeitest dazu eng mit den Bereichen Strategie, Content, SEO, SEA und Technology zusammen. Wir schaffen einzigartige digitale Produkte für verschiedene Kunden wie z. B. Congstar, DeepL, ESPRIT, Mainova, Microsoft, Motel One, STIEBEL ELTRON und STORCK. Um dein Onboarding abzurunden, erwarten dich regelmäßige Feedbackgespräche. Als „Great Place to Work 2024“-Arbeitgeber ist uns deine Meinung wichtig, denn wir leben eine offene Feedback-Kultur! Wir feiern gerne, besonders unsere Erfolge – freue dich auf Feste aller Art, wie unsere Sommerpartys und Weihnachtsfeiern.

Deine Ansprechpartnerinnen

Janina Schulte-Kellinghaus, Marie Rybarczik & Rusin Hassan, Talent Acquisition Team

Unser Profil auf kununu Über uns

Hi, we’re denkwerk!

Unsere Mission ist es, die digitale Zukunft - besonders die unserer Kunden - mitzugestalten.

Was uns antreibt, ist ein Zusammenspiel aus Strategie, Design, Kommunikation und Technologie - wir nennen das Creative Business.

Und wenn wir Creative Business sagen, dann meinen wir kreative und bedürfnisorientierte Lösungen für Marken und Menschen, die beiden einen Mehrwert bieten.

Title: Data Engineer / Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
The PACE Flight Operations Team is currently looking for a Data Engineer / Data Analyst (m/f/d). The position is a full-time position, to be held in Berlin, Germany. In that role you are part of a team, that is developing a new product in the field of civil aviation. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, data engineering, and a keen interest in the aviation or flight operations domain. You will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting complex datasets related to flight operations and -performance. Your insights will help drive strategic decisions and innovations in our application. Be part of making the aviation more efficient!

Responsibilities & Job Description


You are responsible for the data analytics of our Flight Profile Optimizer
You will maintain and re-new the necessary infrastructure
You collect, process, and analyze large datasets from various sources, including flight data, maintenance records, and operational logs.
You develop and maintain data pipelines and ETL processes to ensure data integrity and accessibility.
You perform statistical analysis and create and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders and customers
You collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, product owners, and aviation experts, to understand data requirements and deliver actionable insights.
You ensure data quality and implement best practices for data governance and stay up-to-date with industry trends and advancements in data analysis and aviation technology.



Required Qualifications

Mandatory


You hold a bachelor’s or master’s degree in data science, computer science, statistics, engineering, or a related field.
You have at least 3 years of experience as a data engineer or data analyst
You have proven experience as a data analyst, data engineer, or similar role, preferably in the aviation domain.
You are proficient in data analysis tools and programming languages such as SQL, Python, R, and data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI.
You have experience with big data technologies and platforms (e.g., Snowflake, AWS, Azure)
You have strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
You are excellent in communication and collaboration skills.
You are able to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.



Desired


You understand flight operations, aircraft systems and maintenance procedures
You have a good mathematical understanding
An aerospace background is a plus
Experience with flight data monitoring (FDM) and analysis.
An AWS certificate is a plus
Familiarity with machine learning techniques and tools.



Behavioral skills


You have a solution-oriented mindset
You are a fast learner and able to work independently / with own responsibility



We offer


An interesting job in the aerospace industry with direct interaction with many leading aerospace companies
Working with very talented and passionate people in a professional environment.
International projects with the opportunity to gain deep domain knowledge and expertise.
A modern office with top-of-the-line equipment, situated in the historic Westend train station with great transport accessibility.
Employee discounts from top suppliers from different business areas
Flexibility to work from home
A comprehensive compensation package
20 days per year of mobile working from other EU countries



If you find this position interesting, please send us your cover letter, CV, certificates and references.

HTML:
The PACE Flight Operations Team is currently looking for a Data Engineer / Data Analyst (m/f/d). The position is a full-time position, to be held in Berlin, Germany. In that role you are part of a team, that is developing a new product in the field of civil aviation. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, data engineering, and a keen interest in the aviation or flight operations domain. You will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting complex datasets related to flight operations and -performance. Your insights will help drive strategic decisions and innovations in our application. Be part of making the aviation more efficient!

Responsibilities & Job Description

  • You are responsible for the data analytics of our Flight Profile Optimizer
  • You will maintain and re-new the necessary infrastructure
  • You collect, process, and analyze large datasets from various sources, including flight data, maintenance records, and operational logs.
  • You develop and maintain data pipelines and ETL processes to ensure data integrity and accessibility.
  • You perform statistical analysis and create and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders and customers
  • You collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, product owners, and aviation experts, to understand data requirements and deliver actionable insights.
  • You ensure data quality and implement best practices for data governance and stay up-to-date with industry trends and advancements in data analysis and aviation technology.


Required Qualifications

Mandatory

  • You hold a bachelor’s or master’s degree in data science, computer science, statistics, engineering, or a related field.
  • You have at least 3 years of experience as a data engineer or data analyst
  • You have proven experience as a data analyst, data engineer, or similar role, preferably in the aviation domain.
  • You are proficient in data analysis tools and programming languages such as SQL, Python, R, and data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI.
  • You have experience with big data technologies and platforms (e.g., Snowflake, AWS, Azure)
  • You have strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
  • You are excellent in communication and collaboration skills.
  • You are able to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.


Desired

  • You understand flight operations, aircraft systems and maintenance procedures
  • You have a good mathematical understanding
  • An aerospace background is a plus
  • Experience with flight data monitoring (FDM) and analysis.
  • An AWS certificate is a plus
  • Familiarity with machine learning techniques and tools.


Behavioral skills

  • You have a solution-oriented mindset
  • You are a fast learner and able to work independently / with own responsibility


We offer

  • An interesting job in the aerospace industry with direct interaction with many leading aerospace companies
  • Working with very talented and passionate people in a professional environment.
  • International projects with the opportunity to gain deep domain knowledge and expertise.
  • A modern office with top-of-the-line equipment, situated in the historic Westend train station with great transport accessibility.
  • Employee discounts from top suppliers from different business areas
  • Flexibility to work from home
  • A comprehensive compensation package
  • 20 days per year of mobile working from other EU countries


If you find this position interesting, please send us your cover letter, CV, certificates and references.

Title: Staff Data Analyst - Digital Tracking (f/m/x)
Description:
The role

Our Behavioral Data Squad is a cross-functional team with end-to-end ownership of digital tracking across all markets globally at HelloFresh, from infrastructure all the way to the curated data products. As our Staff Data Analyst, you will play an integral part in ensuring data quality, governance and observability by defining and building the metrics, visualisations, and targets within the squad. You will also be a data detective, deep diving into root cause analyses of tracking discrepancies or anomalous readings, to further drive up trust and adoption.

If you are an expert analyst and a self-starter, with the product-sense to create effective success metrics and use these to inspire trust in a global business, this could be the role for you. Your deep understanding of behavioural tracking infrastructure, data models, and how this data should be consumed efficiently will ensure your impact across the breadth of HelloTech, proactively identifying needs and pain points across Data Infrastructure, Platform, Engineering and Analytics, and defining solutions to constantly improve the way we work. So while you are an individual contributor, you are a key owner of best practices across our teams.

What You’ll Do


Accountable for your teams’ data catalogue and delivery documentation
Collaborate from a technical perspective with data product managers and data engineers to create reusable data products
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and define project objectives while utilising project management skills to plan and execute data-driven projects
Partner widely across the Senior Product organisation (Product, Software Engineering, UX leads) to set strategic priorities and promote a culture rooted in evidence-based decision making.
Communicate actionable insights clearly across the organisation highlighting the “so-whats” of your analyses in order to drive the growth of our business.
Explore and analyse customer behaviour and product performance data in order to detect growth opportunities for the HelloFresh digital product by improving user experience.
Guide and mentor other Product Analysts within our team, defining best practices and providing support to help individuals and the team grow in effectiveness
Review as a technical expert the implementations of multiple teams across domains, continuously improving the deliverables of your teams


What You'll Bring


Experience with digital tracking and tag management in a B2C environment
Extensive experience in quantitative analysis roles, ideally including having worked closely with product teams for at least 5 years.
Excellent technical skills applying expert level SQL and Python for both analysis and efficient manipulation of large data sets.
Expert level knowledge of data visualisation tools like Tableau which we use to create compelling visualisations to convey complex data.
Extensive experience working with product stakeholders in setting up A|B experiments, interpreting results and deep diving to understand the impact of particular experiments.
Excellent communication skills, taking complex business problems, articulating these as analytical problems and presenting your findings in a clear and precise way.
Extensive leadership of complex projects you have led, capability building within your team, and through mentorship or direct people management.
A change mindset, the status quo is not an impediment
You are outcome oriented, and can take a business challenge, create actionable analytical insights against it, and align stakeholders on actions to create business value.
