Title: Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d)




As a Lead Game Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our games' success by leveraging data insights to drive strategic decisions across game design, player behavior analysis, and monetization strategies. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure our games remain competitive and captivating in the dynamic gaming industry landscape.




We have ambitious plans around growth and the data team is integral to our success, directly impacting our key decisions.

As the Lead Data Analyst, you will lead a team of data analysts and spearhead our data efforts in Product, User Acquisition and monetization, leveraging data to drive decisions and strategies that significantly boost our performance and revenue.




Responsibilities




Lead and mentor a team of data analysts, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning.
Utilize exceptional problem-solving and critical-thinking skills to interpret complex game telemetry data and identify actionable insights.
Communicate effectively with stakeholders and executive leadership, presenting data-driven recommendations to drive informed decision-making.
Champion a data-driven culture within the organization, promoting data literacy and empowering team members to leverage key performance indicators (KPIs) for strategic initiatives.
Work with the Data Engineering team to help direct their efforts and be the key communicator between the main stakeholders in the company requiring data
Drive experimentation and A/B testing initiatives to evaluate the impact of game changes on player behavior, monetization, and engagement.
Analyze player retention and churn rates, identifying opportunities to enhance player experiences and maximize long-term value.
Collaborate with Product Leads and Head of Growth to influence product development and strategies by gaining insights through analysis of patterns, relationships and trends across complex data sets, directly impacting the company and game revenue.
Stay updated on industry trends and best practices, leveraging advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies to maintain a competitive edge, as well as, digital marketing environment and marketing measuring frameworks.
Build and monitor predictive models that will help daily Product, User Acquisition and Monetization decisions.




Required Skills




5+ years of experience in data analysis in the gaming industry.
Proven experience managing a team, having exceptional leadership and team-building capabilities
Experience with real-time data analysis for live operations in games.
Ability to write complex queries using languages such as SQL
Experience using Python, BI tools such as Looker or similar
Previous experience with AB testing
Advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies as well as key gaming industry KPIs and metrics
Games industry experience with a strong understanding of the game and player market
Strong problem-solving skills and creativity in addressing complex challenges.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.




Desirable Skills




Proficiency in additional programming languages (e.g., Java, C#, etc.).
Advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies or game industry pattern
Experience with Product Data Science, including but not limited to Churn Prediction, LTV.
An applied understanding of Player Psychology and/or Economics.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Business Analytics
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

This specific position is within our Business Analytics and will see you collaborate primarily with the Supply Tech Team to improve supplier engagement and, in turn increase the inventory available on the marketplace for our travellers

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to drive product and business decisions and strategy
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports
Serve as a liaison between the product teams and the data engineering team
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg: pandas, scikit-learn)
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice to have


Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus
Experience working in Marketplace business
Experience solving Marketplace operations questions, such as understanding inventory diversity.
Experience in statistical modelling.
Experience in B2B product analytics.


How We Set You Up For Success


Invest in your development with an annual personal growth budget
Create a comfortable workspace at home with an annual home office budget
Enjoy flexibility with a hybrid work-from-home and telecommuting policy
Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Financial Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
Deine Aufgaben


Du entwickelst eine neue Prozessmodellierung für Finanzdaten und baust sie auf
Dabei erstellst du neue Dashboards und Auswertungen zur Datenanalyse und visualisierst Trends
Du bringst dein Erfahrungswissen bei Entscheidungsgrundlagen für das Management ein und bereitest diese vor
Du wirkst aktiv bei der Implementierung neuer Applikationen und Tools mit und bist für die erforderliche Anpassung von Geschäftsprozessen mitverantwortlich
Deine Expertise bringst du proaktiv bei der Aufbereitung verschiedener finanzrelevanter Projekte ein
In direkter Berichtslinie arbeitest du eng mit unserem Vice President Finance & Admin zusammen


Dein Profil


Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Studium in einem wirtschaftswissenschaftlichen Bereich vorzugsweise mit dem Schwerpunkt Finanzen, oder eine abgeschlossene, kaufmännische Ausbildung
Du bist erfahren in der Erstellung von Reports und Präsentationen (mittels BI Tools und MS Office)
Deine Argumentationssicherheit basiert auf Zahlen, Daten & Fakten
Du bist eine eigenständige und selbstorganisierte Arbeitsweise gewohnt, dabei aber ein Teamplayer
Du bringst Passion und Freude an der Analyse und Auswertung von Daten und digitalen Lösungen mit
Du verfügst über Kommunikationsstärke und eine Ausgeprägte Service- und Kundenorientierung
Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse


Freu Dich Drauf


Zukunftsweisende Technologien für den Alltag entwickeln
Spannende Projekte und vielfältige Aufgabenfelder mit großer Wirkung
Gestaltungsfreiraum und Eigenverantwortung bei der Entwicklung von Qualitätsprodukten zum Anfassen
Flexibles Arbeiten mit der Option, mehrere Tage pro Woche im Homeoffice zu arbeiten
44 Euro Beitrag zum Deutschlandticket
Vermögenswirksame Leistungen in Höhe von 27 Euro pro Monat
30 Tage Urlaub sowie Heiligabend und Silvester frei
Individuelle Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten und eine offene Voneinander-Lern-Kultur wie z.B. im Rahmen unserer Developer Coffee Breaks
Einzigartige Teamevents, z.B. Grillevents, Weihnachtsfeier und das große AVM Sommerfest, zu dem auch deine Familie miteingeladen ist

Title: Staff Data Analyst - BI and Marketing Analytics (All genders)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are looking for a Staff Data Analyst (All genders) to join the BI and Marketing Analytic ( BIMA) team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences. This is a global position working closely with our brands in over 70 countries and implementing strategy from our HQ in Berlin.

BIMA is part of the Global marketing team responsible for central BI and marketing analytics . BIMA’ s team mission is to drive marketing actions through data-driven solutions & strategic insights to ensure sustainable growth. We drive strategic projects such as customer segmentation, marketing ROI measurement , CLV and support the C-level in making strategic decisions across all brands and countries.

If you're a creative problem solver who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!

The Staff Data Analyst will be responsible for optimizing our marketing strategies through data-driven insights and advanced analytics. This role will collaborate closely with the marketing leads , product, and data science teams, and regional analytic teams to analyze marketing performance and optimize our acquisition and retention strategies.

Your key responsibilities include :


Utilize analytics to provide actionable insights on marketing performance.
Design and implement A/B testing and other experimental frameworks to assess the effectiveness of marketing initiatives.
Create tools , KPI frameworks, and reports to measure ROI of marketing spend. Continuously monitor and guide marketing spend across various channels to maximize ROI.
Analyze and improve the customer segmentation to drive targeting strategies in the local markets and increase customer retention
Create statistical models to project customer lifetime value, measure customer acquisition costs (CAC) and use analytics to reduce CAC and increase LTV
Work closely with marketing, product, and engineering teams to ensure alignment on data needs and create global guidelines on how data needs to be collected and consumed.
Present findings and recommendations to senior leadership and stakeholders in a clear and actionable manner.


What you need to be successful


4+ years of experience in marketing analytics, with a focus on user retention for technology-driven consumer facing companies.
Strong proficiency in analytics tools and platforms (e.g., Google Big Query, Google Analytics, Tableau, SQL, Python/R).
Exceptional analytical skills with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels.
Experience with A/B testing, attribution modeling, and other experimental design methodologies.
Strong understanding of digital marketing channels and strategies, including CRM, paid search, social media, and content marketing.


Nice to have:


Experience in agile development and methodologies
BS, MS or PhD in computer science, statistics, math, physic, business, etc
Expertise in developing and implementing naming conventions and tagging strategies to ensure data consistency in a global organization. Experience with Market mix modeling


Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts


At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.
Show more
HTML:
About The Opportunity

We are looking for a Staff Data Analyst (All genders) to join the BI and Marketing Analytic ( BIMA) team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences. This is a global position working closely with our brands in over 70 countries and implementing strategy from our HQ in Berlin.

BIMA is part of the Global marketing team responsible for central BI and marketing analytics . BIMA’ s team mission is to drive marketing actions through data-driven solutions & strategic insights to ensure sustainable growth. We drive strategic projects such as customer segmentation, marketing ROI measurement , CLV and support the C-level in making strategic decisions across all brands and countries.

If you're a creative problem solver who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!

The Staff Data Analyst will be responsible for optimizing our marketing strategies through data-driven insights and advanced analytics. This role will collaborate closely with the marketing leads , product, and data science teams, and regional analytic teams to analyze marketing performance and optimize our acquisition and retention strategies.

Your key responsibilities include :

  • Utilize analytics to provide actionable insights on marketing performance.
  • Design and implement A/B testing and other experimental frameworks to assess the effectiveness of marketing initiatives.
  • Create tools , KPI frameworks, and reports to measure ROI of marketing spend. Continuously monitor and guide marketing spend across various channels to maximize ROI.
  • Analyze and improve the customer segmentation to drive targeting strategies in the local markets and increase customer retention
  • Create statistical models to project customer lifetime value, measure customer acquisition costs (CAC) and use analytics to reduce CAC and increase LTV
  • Work closely with marketing, product, and engineering teams to ensure alignment on data needs and create global guidelines on how data needs to be collected and consumed.
  • Present findings and recommendations to senior leadership and stakeholders in a clear and actionable manner.

What you need to be successful

  • 4+ years of experience in marketing analytics, with a focus on user retention for technology-driven consumer facing companies.
  • Strong proficiency in analytics tools and platforms (e.g., Google Big Query, Google Analytics, Tableau, SQL, Python/R).
  • Exceptional analytical skills with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels.
  • Experience with A/B testing, attribution modeling, and other experimental design methodologies.
  • Strong understanding of digital marketing channels and strategies, including CRM, paid search, social media, and content marketing.

Nice to have:

  • Experience in agile development and methodologies
  • BS, MS or PhD in computer science, statistics, math, physic, business, etc
  • Expertise in developing and implementing naming conventions and tagging strategies to ensure data consistency in a global organization. Experience with Market mix modeling

Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.

  • Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
  • We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
  • Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape
  • Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
  • Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
  • Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
  • The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts

At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Location: Onsite. Berlin Mitte, Germany.

About Us

Founded in 2021, our company operates a pioneering marketplace that redefines one of the largest supply chains in the world from out of the heart of Berlin. Our mission is to unlock the vast potential of cross-border supply for the Western Market by providing global access to high-quality products through our innovative platform.

Since our launch in January 2022, we have operated discreetly, successfully serving hundreds of companies without a public profile or media coverage. We cater to both major industry players and mid-sized companies, utilizing a cutting-edge technology platform that is experiencing rapid growth. Having secured substantial capital from top-tier VCs, Unicorn and Decacorn founders, and industry experts through various funding rounds, we are well-funded, 50 people strong, and expanding our team!

About This Role

We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team in the heart of Berlin. In this pivotal role, you will define and execute our data modeling and analysis strategy, drive data governance and quality assurance excellence, take the lead in tool and system innovation, and introduce best practices and mentoring.

You will work closely with business intelligence professionals, senior engineers, data analysts, and business stakeholders from sales, procurement, and accounting to develop features that drive business growth.

Tasks

What You Will Do


Lead the development and maintenance of the company’s BI structure to support strategic business initiatives
Conduct complex data analysis to extract deep insights and trends that drive business growth and operational efficiency
Create advanced dashboards, reports, and visualizations that facilitate data-driven decision-making at all levels of the organization
Act as a strategic partner to senior management and department heads, understanding their data needs and delivering actionable intelligence
Translate high-level business requirements into detailed technical specifications for robust data reporting and analysis
Facilitate data-driven discussions and workshops with stakeholders to enhance organizational data literacy
Ensure the accuracy, consistency, and integrity of data across the organization
Develop and implement comprehensive data validation and cleansing processes to maintain the highest data quality standards
Lead the continuous improvement and optimization of the BI infrastructure and reporting capabilities using advanced BI tools and platforms (such as Tableau, Power BI, SQL, and Databricks)
Mentor and develop junior analysts, fostering a culture of continuous learning and professional growth within the team



Requirements

What you bring


Master’s degree in Business, Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field. A Master’s degree is strongly preferred.
5+ years of extensive experience in business intelligence, data analysis, and reporting.
Proven track record of delivering strategic insights and high-quality reports in a fast-paced environment.
Advanced proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau/Power BI, SQL and Google Sheets
Experience with data warehousing, ETL processes, and real-time data processing frameworks



Who You Are


Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex datasets and translate them into actionable business insights
Excellent communication skills with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders
Strong ability to present data insights and strategic recommendations to diverse audiences, including senior leadership
High level of attention to detail and accuracy in data analysis and reporting
Ability to ensure data quality and integrity in all analytical processes
Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and drive results in a rapidly evolving organization



Benefits

What we offer


A role with entrepreneurial freedom in a pre-validated business model, to push to the next level
An experienced founding team of serial founders
A future-proof job with an attractive salary
Collaboration with top-tier investors and angles (incl. various unicorn founders) as well as leading market experts
A challenging yet rewarding work environment, and the opportunity to make a significant impact within a rapidly growing company
Beautiful office space in the center of Berlin, monthly All-Hands, team events, and team lunches



Join one of the fastest-growing B2B companies in Europe, led by an international, intercultural team of serial entrepreneurs, and experienced executives!

Internal job reference: 7b906e50-fcaa-4972-90c8-418ed163b669

Title: Trainee Consultant Business Intelligence (m/w/d)
Description:
Willkommen bei CBTW! Wir sind ein innovatives Team mit über 3.000 Mitarbeitern in 21 Ländern und führend in den Bereichen Strategie & Governance, Software-Engineering, Datenanalyse & KI und mehr.

Als Mitglied unseres Teams bei CBTW arbeitest Du in einem inspirierenden Umfeld an anspruchsvollen Projekten. Wir fördern die Entwicklung der Experten von morgen und schätzen Deine Ideen. Wenn Du bereit bist, die Zukunft der datengetriebenen Transformation mit einem hochmotivierten Team zu gestalten, bewirb Dich jetzt bei CBTW! Zusammen schaffen wir Großartiges.

Aufgaben

Wir suchen einen motivierten Trainee Consultant Business Intelligence, der unsere dynamische Teamumgebung bereichert und sich weiterentwickeln möchte. Als Trainee Consultant Business Intelligence bei CBTW arbeitest du an der Schnittstelle von Datenanalyse und Geschäftsstrategie, um unseren Kunden fundierte Einblicke und Lösungen zu bieten. Wenn du dich als Experten siehst, komplexe Daten zu verstehen, zu analysieren und in handlungsorientierte Empfehlungen zu verwandeln, bist du bei uns genau richtig.

Zu deinen Aufgaben gehören:


Unterstützung bei der Beratung von Kunden bei der Entwicklung und Umsetzung von Business-Intelligence-Strategien und -Lösungen
Mitwirkung an der Analyse von Geschäftsdaten und -prozessen, um Muster, Trends und Chancen zu identifizieren
Mitarbeit am Entwurf, der Entwicklung und Implementierung von BI-Lösungen und Dashboards zur Visualisierung von Daten
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Kunden und internen Teams, um Geschäftsanforderungen zu verstehen und maßgeschneiderte Lösungen zu liefern
Bereitstellung von Schulungen und Unterstützung für Kunden zur effektiven Nutzung von Business-Intelligence-Tools und -Plattformen
Aktive Teilnahme an der kontinuierlichen Weiterentwicklung von Fachkenntnissen in Bezug auf BI-Technologien, -Methoden und -Best Practices



Qualifikation

Dein Talent


Abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften oder einer verwandten Disziplin
Erste Erfahrungen oder Praktika im Bereich Business-Intelligence oder der Datenanalyse sind von Vorteil
Grundlegendes Verständnis von BI-Tools wie z.B. Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, Cognos Analytics, SAS VA, SAP Analytics oder ähnlichen Plattformen
Grundkenntnisse in Datenbanken, Datenmodellierung und Abfragesprachen (z.B. SQL)
Idealerweise Kenntnisse in Python oder ein allgemeines Verständnis über die Grundlagen der Programmierung
Analytisches Denkvermögen und die Fähigkeit, komplexe Probleme zu lösen
Gute Kommunikations- und Präsentationsfähigkeiten
Teamorientierung und die Fähigkeit, effektiv in multidisziplinären Teams zu arbeiten
Fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse



Es ist unwahrscheinlich, dass jede:r Kandidat:in all diese Anforderungen erfüllt. Wenn Deine Erfahrungen anders sind und Du glaubst, dass Du einen Mehrwert für die Position bieten kannst, lass uns gerne darüber sprechen!

Benefits

Unser Versprechen

Wir bieten Dir eine Kultur, die von unseren Führungsleitsätzen angetrieben wird: unternehmerisch, ergebnisorientiert, Eigenverantwortung fördernd und sich gegenseitig zum Erfolg verhelfend. Wir schaffen Transparenz über Unternehmensziele, Zusammenarbeit und Unterstützung durch ein internationales Team auf Augenhöhe. Wir leben Austausch, Teamgeist und einen respektvollen Umgang miteinander. Das verbindet uns hierarchieübergreifend – auch im Home-Office. So erhielten wir in 2022, 2023 und 2024 die kununu Auszeichnung „TOP Company“.

Das erwartet Dich bei uns:


Onboarding: Vernetzung ab dem ersten Tag - Welcome Day, Hello Drink, Mentoring-Programm.
Entwicklung: Individuelle Förderung Deiner Stärken - Regelmäßige Feedbackgespräche, Karrierepfade, Career Committees, Online-Trainingskatalog, internationales Arbeiten mit verschiedenen Kulturen.
Work-Life-Balance: Raum für Deine Lebensplanung - Sabbatical, Remote Working aus dem Ausland, flexible Arbeitsmodelle, Elternzeitprogramme, 30 Tage Urlaub, Feiertagskalender Baden-Württemberg.
Nachhaltigkeit: Unsere Arbeit hat einen positiven Einfluss auf die Umwelt und die Gesellschaft - wir machen unsere Lösungen und Zusammenarbeit jeden Tag nachhaltiger.
Events: Fachliche und unterhaltsame Events - Summer-Tech-Event, lokale Afterworks, Sportevents, Teamevents, Weihnachtsfeiern.
Netzwerken: Verbinde Dich mit internationalen Kolleg:innen - Communities, Lunch Breaks, interne Know-How Sessions.
Fehlerkultur: Teste Dich aus und lerne aus Fehlern - Wir geben Dir Freiraum, mit neuesten Technologien zu arbeiten.
Prämien: Zahlreiche Prämien für zusätzliches Engagement.
Weitere Vorteile: Digitales Mobilitätsbudget, Corporate Benefits, Jobfahrrad, Deutschlandticket, betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement.



Schau Dir unsere CBTW Spotify Playlist an und erhalte einen ersten musikalischen Eindruck von unserem Team: https://open.spotify.com/playlist/44kgWZRt5jmmgppH0qGszg?si=L312ch\_9SMKsCKBcN-EB\_A

Aber genug von uns, jetzt bist Du an der Reihe - Wir freuen uns darauf, Dich kennenzulernen!

Title: Speech/Text Analyst
Description:
At eBay, we're more than a global ecommerce leader — we’re changing the way the world shops and sells. Our platform empowers millions of buyers and sellers in more than 190 markets around the world. We’re committed to pushing boundaries and leaving our mark as we reinvent the future of ecommerce for enthusiasts.

Our customers are our compass, authenticity thrives, bold ideas are welcome, and everyone can bring their unique selves to work — every day. We're in this together, sustaining the future of our customers, our company, and our planet.

Join a team of passionate thinkers, innovators, and dreamers — and help us connect people and build communities to create economic opportunity for all.

About The Role And Team

As a speech & text analyst supporting our Service Insights program, you are key to our GCX transformation project! You will support our transformational project to understand what is driving customer contacts, effort, and satisfaction. We will be making recommendations on process, policy, and product changes that improve the customer journey. You will design and build speech/ text analytics models from multiple data sources such as chats, phone calls, email, and surveys. You will implement CX processes, tools, and measurement systems that drive customer centricity as well as employee engagement. You will work with partners to understand their goals and use speech/text analytics to identify key problems as well as enable closed loop feedback processes.

To be successful in this role, you should provide a strategic perspective, possess a focused, analytical mind, with the ability to connect the dots and identify the big picture. You have an unwavering advocacy for the customers we serve.

What you will accomplish


Build speech/text analytics models in German and English
Lead and take part in analysis projects including light analytics & statistical analysis
Evaluate customer experiences and recommend solutions for improvement
Manage speech/text analytics model health for all GCX programs
Support our CS tech partners on back end technical updates
Serve as a subject matter expert for GCX organization on speech/text analytics
Perform in-depth analysis to identify gaps and opportunities and propose impactful enhancements
Ensure compliance with customer and company standards



What you will bring

Being in such a dynamic role you will have a blend set of core and adjacent skills.

Core Skills & Proficiencies


1-2 years experience building speech analytics models, text analytics models, or similar technologies (including CallMiner, NICE, Nexidia, XM Discover, etc.)
1-2 years experience in CX using customer data to understand problems, making recommendations, and working cross functionally to improve the customer experience.
Track record driving CX innovation and initiatives with a view to enhance the customer experience and uplift satisfaction.
Fluency in German and English. Proficiency with Spanish, French, or Italian is a plus.



Additional Considerations


Experience managing projects. Project management certification is a plus.
Deep knowledge of eBay and familiarity with buying and selling on eBay’s platform.
Organizational dexterity – ability to interact across all levels within the organization.
Strong emotional intelligence and skills in leading robust cross-functional relationships.
Effective communicator with written and oral presentations. Demonstrate solid presentation, demonstration, and technical writing skills.
Must be able to use deep problem-solving skills to unpack issues/questions and develop relevant solutions.
Experience with analytical software (Tableau, SQL (Teradata), data warehouse, etc.) is a plus.
Level of Education: 4-yr degree or equivalent experience.



Please see the Talent Privacy Notice for information regarding how eBay handles your personal data collected when you use the eBay Careers website or apply for a job with eBay.

eBay is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for accommodation as soon as possible. View our accessibility statement to learn more about eBay's commitment to ensuring digital accessibility for people with disabilities.

Jobs posted with location as "Remote - United States (Excludes: HI, NM)" excludes residents of Hawaii and New Mexico.

This website uses cookies to enhance your experience. By continuing to browse the site, you agree to our use of cookies. Visit our Privacy Center for more information.

  • Lead and take part in analysis projects including light analytics & statistical analysis
  • Evaluate customer experiences and recommend solutions for improvement
  • Manage speech/text analytics model health for all GCX programs
  • Support our CS tech partners on back end technical updates
  • Serve as a subject matter expert for GCX organization on speech/text analytics
  • Perform in-depth analysis to identify gaps and opportunities and propose impactful enhancements
  • Ensure compliance with customer and company standards


What you will bring

Being in such a dynamic role you will have a blend set of core and adjacent skills.

Core Skills & Proficiencies

  • 1-2 years experience building speech analytics models, text analytics models, or similar technologies (including CallMiner, NICE, Nexidia, XM Discover, etc.)
  • 1-2 years experience in CX using customer data to understand problems, making recommendations, and working cross functionally to improve the customer experience.
  • Track record driving CX innovation and initiatives with a view to enhance the customer experience and uplift satisfaction.
  • Fluency in German and English. Proficiency with Spanish, French, or Italian is a plus.


Additional Considerations

  • Experience managing projects. Project management certification is a plus.
  • Deep knowledge of eBay and familiarity with buying and selling on eBay’s platform.
  • Organizational dexterity – ability to interact across all levels within the organization.
  • Strong emotional intelligence and skills in leading robust cross-functional relationships.
  • Effective communicator with written and oral presentations. Demonstrate solid presentation, demonstration, and technical writing skills.
  • Must be able to use deep problem-solving skills to unpack issues/questions and develop relevant solutions.
  • Experience with analytical software (Tableau, SQL (Teradata), data warehouse, etc.) is a plus.
  • Level of Education: 4-yr degree or equivalent experience.

Title: Lead Analytics Analyst (f/m/x) - Data Analyst in AFC M&S Global Platform
Description:
Position Overview

Die Deutsche Bank (DB) kann auf eine sehr erfahrene und engagierte Abteilung für die Bekämpfung von Finanzkriminalität (Anti Financial Crime, AFC) zurückgreifen. Diese spielt eine entscheidende Rolle dabei, der Finanzkriminalität bei Geschäftsaktivitäten und globalen Finanzdienstleistungen der DB vorzubeugen und gleichzeitig die Interessen der Bank und der Gesellschaft zu wahren.

Um Finanzkriminalität wirksam zu bekämpfen und flexibel auf Herausforderungen zu reagieren, hat AFC eine Matrixstruktur, die regionale, geschäftsbereichsbezogene und globale Funktionen vereint. Sie teilt sich in die folgenden Kernbereiche auf: Anti-Money Laundering, Sanctions & Embargoes, Anti-Fraud, Bribery & Corruption, Investigations & Intelligence, Monitoring & Screening und Risk Assessment. Teil unseres Engagements ist es, eine enge Zusammenarbeit mit allen Geschäftsbereichen und Unterstützungsfunktionen innerhalb unserer Bank zu stärken.

Was AFC für Sie tun wird

AFC hilft der Deutschen Bank, langfristig Vertrauen und Mehrwert für unsere Kunden, Mitarbeiter*innen und die Gesellschaft zu schaffen. Dabei wenden wir die höchsten Verhaltensstandards an, um den Erfolg der DB bei der Bekämpfung der Finanzkriminalität zu gewährleisten. Wir bieten Ihnen herausfordernde Möglichkeiten, zu lernen, einen Beitrag zu leisten und von Ihrer Reise mit uns zu profitieren. Wir fördern eine offene und integrative Teamkultur mit dem Ziel, eine gesunde, engagierte und gut unterstützte vielfältige Belegschaft aufzubauen und zu erhalten, die in der Lage ist, ihr Bestes zu geben.

Teambeschreibung und Rollendetails

Anti-Financial Crime

Das Management von Risiken im Zusammenhang mit Finanzkriminalität und die Implementierung gültiger und wirksamer Kontrollen, Prozesse und Sicherheitsmaßnahmen haben für die Deutsche Bank höchste Priorität. AFC Monitoring & Screening Global Plattform (GP) ist verantwortlich für die Implementierung der strategischen Transaktionsüberwachungsplattform und die Weiterentwicklung der bestehenden Transaktionsüberwachungs- und Namenslisten-Screening-Systeme. Daten sind die Grundlage für umfassende Kontrollen und ein Schlüsselbereich für die Identifizierung von Risiken im Zusammenhang mit Finanzkriminalität.

Ihre Hauptverantwortlichkeiten

Innerhalb von AFCs GP konzentriert sich die „Intelligence Layer“ Funktion auf die Anwendung erweiterter Analyse Funktionen mit Bezug auf die verwendeten Daten. In dieser Funktion analysieren Sie Daten, und entwickeln daraus Erkenntnisse und Empfehlungen. Sie arbeiten eng mit funktionsübergreifenden Teams zusammen, um Geschäftsanforderungen mit analytischem Fachwissen zu unterstützen. Sie arbeiten mit weiteren Analysten, Dateningenieuren und Wissenschaftlern zusammen, um qualitativ hochwertige Ergebnisse durch die Anwendung fortschrittlicher Analysemethoden auf unsere Daten zu ermöglichen.

Für diese Rolle verfügen Sie über fundierte Erfahrungen in den Bereichen:


Analyse und Zusammensetzung von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen, um Trends und Muster zu identifizieren
Umsetzung von Geschäftsanforderungen und Risikodefinitionen in anwendbare Analyseaktivitäten und Entwicklung von Erkenntnissen und Empfehlungen zur Unterstützung von Anforderungen im Bereich Anti-Financial Crime
Transformation von Daten in verwendbare Formate und standardisierte Protokolle
Fähigkeit, ein ganzheitliches Verständnis der bestehenden Daten und Datenquellen der Bank aufzubauen
Entwicklung von Modellen und Datenvisualisierung
der Zusammenarbeit mit Architekten, Infrastrukturexperten und Dateningenieuren in einem internationalen Umfeld für die Datenanalyse



Ihre Kompetenzen und Erfahrungen


Sie verfügen über ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Mathematik, Physik oder vergleichbare Qualifikationen und Erfahrungen
Erfahrung mit Datenverarbeitungs- und Integrationspipelines in einem Big Data/ETL-Kontext unter Verwendung von GCP, Hadoop, Apache Spark, Shell-Scripting, Testframeworks oder anderen Komponenten aus dem Ökosystem
Sie haben mindestens 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Entwicklung mit Python, oder ähnlichen Programmiersprachen mit Fokus auf Big Data und ein fundiertes Verständnis für Data Analytics und statistische Methoden
Erfahrungen in den Bereichen Finanzkriminalität und Banken mit deren Transaktionsprozessen
Sie sind ein Teamplayer und verfügen über eine hohe persönliche Integrität mit sehr guten Englischkenntnissen in Wort und Schrift, Deutsch wünschenswert



Die Stelle wird in Voll- und in Teilzeit angeboten

Was wir Ihnen bieten:

Wir bieten eine breite Palette von Leistungen, die all Ihre beruflichen und persönlichen Bedürfnisse abdecken.


Emotional ausgeglichen Eine positive Haltung hilft uns, die Herausforderungen des Alltags zu meistern – beruflich wie privat. Profitieren Sie von Angeboten wie Beratung in schwierigen Lebenssituationen und Angeboten zur Förderung mentaler Gesundheit.
Körperlich fit Mit Angeboten zur Aufrechterhaltung Ihrer persönlichen Gesundheit und einem förderlichen beruflichen Umfeld hilft Ihnen die Bank, körperlich fit zu bleiben. Profitieren Sie von Angeboten wie umfangreichen Check-up Untersuchungen, Impfangeboten und Beratung zur gesunden Lebensführung.
Sozial vernetzt Der Austausch mit anderen eröffnet uns neue Perspektiven, bringt uns beruflich wie persönlich voran und stärkt unser Selbstvertrauen und Wohlbefinden. Profitieren Sie von Angeboten wie Unterstützung durch den pme Familienservice, das FitnessCenter Job, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle (bspw. Teilzeit, Jobtandem, hybrides Arbeiten) sowie einer umfangreichen Kultur der Vielfalt, Chancengleichheit und Teilhabe.
Finanziell abgesichert Die Bank sichert Sie nicht nur während Ihrer aktiven Karriere, sondern auch für die Zukunft finanziell ab und unterstützt Ihre Flexibilität sowie Mobilität – egal ob privat oder beruflich. Profitieren Sie von Angeboten wie Beitragsplänen für Altersvorsorge, Bankdienstleistungen für Mitarbeiter*innen, Firmenfahrrad oder dem Deutschlandticket.



Da die Benefits je nach Standort geringfügig variieren, gehen Sie bitte bei konkreten Fragen auf Ihren Recruiter zu.

Die Stelle wird in Voll- und in Teilzeit angeboten.

Bei Fragen zum Rekrutierungsprozess steht Nana Darko gerne zur Verfügung.

Kontakt: Nana Darko (+49(0)175- 6705312 )

Deutsche Bank (DB) benefits from having a highly experienced and dedicated Anti Financial Crime (AFC) function, which performs a crucial role in keeping DBs business operations and global financial services clean from financial crime while serving the interests of the bank and society.

In order to combat financial crime effectively and respond to challenges in a flexible manner, AFC has a matrix structure combining regional, business line and global functional coverage in our core areas of Anti-Money Laundering, Sanctions & Embargoes, Anti-Fraud, Bribery & Corruption, Investigations & Intelligence, Monitoring & Screening, and Risk Assessment. Part of our commitment is to strengthen a strong collaboration with all business lines and support functions within our bank.

What AFC Will Do For You

AFC helps Deutsche Bank generate long-term trust and add value for our clients, staff and society and provide challenging opportunities for you to learn, contribute and benefit from your journey with us. We foster an open and inclusive team culture with the aim to build and maintain a healthy, engaged and well-supported diverse workforce that is equipped to do their best and enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace, whilst applying the highest standards of conduct to guarantee DB´s success in fighting financial crime.

Team- And Role Description

Anti-Financial Crime

The management of financial crime related risks and the implementation of valid and effective controls, processes and security measures has highest priority for Deutsche Bank. AFC Monitoring & Screening Global Platform (GP) is responsible for the implementation of the strategic Transaction Monitoring platform and the further development of the existing Transaction Monitoring and Name List Screening systems. Data is the basis for comprehensive controls and a key area for the identification of financial crime related risk.

Your Main Responsibilities

Within AFCs GP the “Intelligence Layer” has a focus on the application of advanced analytics to the consumed data. As Data Analyst you will be analyzing data and developing insights and recommendations. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to support business requirements with analytical expertise. Collaboration with analysts, data engineers and scientists to enable quality results from the application of advanced analytics methods to our data.

For this role you should have profound experience in the areas of:


collection and analysis of data from various sources to identify trends and patterns
translation of business requirements and risk definitions into actionable analytics activities and developing insights and recommendations to drive business requirements
organizing data into usable formats and standardized protocols
ability to build a broad understanding of the bank's existing data, and data sources
development of models and data visualization
cooperation with architects, infrastructure experts and data engineers on an international framework for data analysis and enrichment



Your Competencies And Experience


You have a degree in computer science, mathematics, physics or comparable qualifications and experience
Experience with data processing and integration pipelines in a big data/ETL context, using Hadoop, Apache Spark, GCP, shell scripting, test frameworks, or other components from the ecosystem
You have at least 3 years of working experience in Python, or similar programming languages with a focus on big data and a sound understanding for data analytics and statistical methods
Experience in the areas of financial crime and banking with their transaction processes
You are a team player and have as well a high level of personal integrity with excellent oral and written English skills, German desirable



This job is available in full and parttime.

What we offer:

We provide you with a comprehensive portfolio of benefits and offerings to support both, your private and professional needs.


Emotionally and mentally balanced A positive mind helps us master the challenges of everyday life – both professionally and privately. We offer consultation in difficult life situations as well as mental health awareness trainings.
Physically thriving We support you in staying physically fit through an offering to maintain personal health and a professional environment. You can benefit from health check-ups; vaccination drives as well as advice on healthy living and nutrition.
Socially connected Networking opens up new perspectives, helps us thrive professionally and personally as well as strengthens our self-confidence and well-being. You can benefit from PME family service, FitnessCenter Job, flexible working (e.g parttime, hybrid working, job tandem) as well as an extensive culture of diversity, equity and inclusion.
Financially secure We provide you with financial security not only during your active career but also for the future. You can benefit from offerings such as pension plans, banking services, company bicycle or “Deutschlandticket”.



Since our offerings slightly vary across locations, please contact your recruiter with specific questions.

In case of any recruitment related questions, please get in touch with Nana Darko.

Contact: Nana Darko (+49(0)175- 6705312 )

Unsere Werte bestimmen das Arbeitsumfeld, welches wir schaffen möchten – vielfältig, wertschätzend und offen für verschiedene Meinungen. Nur eine Unternehmenskultur, die eine Vielzahl von Perspektiven, sowie kulturellen und gesellschaftlichen Hintergründen vereint, fördert Innovation. Wir setzen auf vielfältige Teams, in welchen die Menschen ihr volles Potential entfalten können – denn das Zusammenführen verschiedener Talente und Ideen spielt eine entscheidende Rolle für den geschäftlichen Erfolg der Deutschen Bank.

Unsere Unternehmenskultur setzt hohe ethische Standards und fördert ein gutes Miteinander. Unabhängig von kulturellem Hintergrund, Nationalität, ethnischer Zugehörigkeit, geschlechtlicher und sexueller Identität, körperlichen Fähigkeiten, Religion und Generation freuen wir uns über Bewerbungen talentierter Menschen.

Sprechen Sie uns an: Wir bieten flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle und weitere Zusatzleistungen, um Sie in Ihrem Berufsleben zu unterstützen.

Besuchen Sie Inside Deutsche Bank , um mehr über die Kultur der Deutschen Bank zu erfahren, einschließlich unserer Aktivitäten zu Vielfalt, Chancengleichheit und Teilhabe, unserer Führungskultur, unseren Aktivitäten zur Zukunft der Arbeit und vieles mehr.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We are a Berlin-based startup that has successfully established a leading B2B marketplace for industrial metals across Europe.

The multi-billion-euro metal trading industry is operated on Excel, PDF and Email. We are on a mission to transform buying and selling in one of the oldest industries of the modern world with seamless and intuitive digital solutions. Our technologies increase liquidity, accelerate transactions, reduce scrapping rates and enhance buying convenience for hundreds of steel and metal distributors across Europe.

As a lean team of young, international, and passionate talents, we've recently reached breakeven and are gearing up for the next phase of growth. We are looking for an outstanding individual who wants to join an exciting early stage start-up as a Data Engineer to work closely with our senior management and a highly motivated team.

Tasks

As a Data Engineer, you will join the team full-time and support the Data Team in providing data insights to the broader organizations. Specifically you will:


Design, develop, and implement data pipelines for ingesting, transforming, and loading data from various sources into our data warehouse.
Define the vision and objectives for data products by working closely with product and data team members
Design & build ELT based data models using SQL & DBT
Work with Google Cloud to provision and manage data storage, compute resources, and containerized applications.
Write code in scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash) to automate data engineering tasks.
Collaborate with data analysts, data scientists, and software engineers to ensure data quality and accessibility.
Develop high-performing and insightful dashboards by providing necessary data infrastructure.
Document data pipelines, schemas, and procedures.
Stay up-to-date on the latest data engineering and cloud technologies.



Requirements


2+ years of professional experience in data engineering field including building data pipelines
Strong expertise in relational databases, including design and performance tuning.
Experience with Google Cloud for data storage, compute resources, and services.
Hands-on production experience with dbt
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
Proficiency in Python; knowledge of JavaScript, Bash, and PowerShell is a plus.
Ability to process and analyze data effectively to drive insights and action
Exceptional attention to detail, ensuring high standards are maintained across all tasks
University degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or a related area
Experience with Looker, Tableau or other dashboarding tools
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Proficiency in English



Benefits


First hand experience with an exciting Berlin tech startup on a steep growth curve
Work closely with an experienced team, keen to train and invest in you
Fast-paced environment and strong company culture for high performing individuals
Unrivaled autonomy and ownership
Open and fun shared working environment/culture
Office located in the heart of Berlin
Competitive compensation, depending on experience

Show more
HTML:
We are a Berlin-based startup that has successfully established a leading B2B marketplace for industrial metals across Europe.

The multi-billion-euro metal trading industry is operated on Excel, PDF and Email. We are on a mission to transform buying and selling in one of the oldest industries of the modern world with seamless and intuitive digital solutions. Our technologies increase liquidity, accelerate transactions, reduce scrapping rates and enhance buying convenience for hundreds of steel and metal distributors across Europe.

As a lean team of young, international, and passionate talents, we've recently reached breakeven and are gearing up for the next phase of growth. We are looking for an outstanding individual who wants to join an exciting early stage start-up as a Data Engineer to work closely with our senior management and a highly motivated team.

Tasks

As a Data Engineer, you will join the team full-time and support the Data Team in providing data insights to the broader organizations. Specifically you will:

  • Design, develop, and implement data pipelines for ingesting, transforming, and loading data from various sources into our data warehouse.
  • Define the vision and objectives for data products by working closely with product and data team members
  • Design & build ELT based data models using SQL & DBT
  • Work with Google Cloud to provision and manage data storage, compute resources, and containerized applications.
  • Write code in scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash) to automate data engineering tasks.
  • Collaborate with data analysts, data scientists, and software engineers to ensure data quality and accessibility.
  • Develop high-performing and insightful dashboards by providing necessary data infrastructure.
  • Document data pipelines, schemas, and procedures.
  • Stay up-to-date on the latest data engineering and cloud technologies.


Requirements

  • 2+ years of professional experience in data engineering field including building data pipelines
  • Strong expertise in relational databases, including design and performance tuning.
  • Experience with Google Cloud for data storage, compute resources, and services.
  • Hands-on production experience with dbt
  • Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
  • Proficiency in Python; knowledge of JavaScript, Bash, and PowerShell is a plus.
  • Ability to process and analyze data effectively to drive insights and action
  • Exceptional attention to detail, ensuring high standards are maintained across all tasks
  • University degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or a related area
  • Experience with Looker, Tableau or other dashboarding tools
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Proficiency in English


Benefits

  • First hand experience with an exciting Berlin tech startup on a steep growth curve
  • Work closely with an experienced team, keen to train and invest in you
  • Fast-paced environment and strong company culture for high performing individuals
  • Unrivaled autonomy and ownership
  • Open and fun shared working environment/culture
  • Office located in the heart of Berlin
  • Competitive compensation, depending on experience

Title: Consultant Business Intelligence (m/w/d)
Description:
Willkommen bei CBTW! Wir sind ein innovatives Team mit über 3.000 Mitarbeitern in 21 Ländern und führend in den Bereichen Strategie & Governance, Software-Engineering, Datenanalyse & KI und mehr.

Als Mitglied unseres Teams bei CBTW arbeitest Du in einem inspirierenden Umfeld an anspruchsvollen Projekten. Wir fördern die Entwicklung der Experten von morgen und schätzen Deine Ideen. Wenn Du bereit bist, die Zukunft der datengetriebenen Transformation mit einem hochmotivierten Team zu gestalten, bewirb Dich jetzt bei CBTW! Zusammen schaffen wir Großartiges.

Aufgaben

Wir suchen einen leidenschaftlichen und erfahrenen Consultant Business Intelligence, der unser dynamisches Team ergänzt. Als Consultant Business Intelligence bei CBTW arbeitest Du an der Schnittstelle von Datenanalyse und Geschäftsstrategie, um unseren Kunden fundierte Einblicke und Lösungen zu bieten. Wenn Du dich als Experte siehst, komplexe Daten zu verstehen, zu analysieren und in handlungsorientierte Empfehlungen zu verwandeln, bist Du bei uns genau richtig.

Zu deinen Aufgaben zählen:


Beratung von Kunden bei der Entwicklung und Umsetzung von Business-Intelligence-Strategien und -Lösungen
Analyse von Geschäftsdaten und -prozessen, um Muster, Trends und Chancen zu identifizieren
Entwurf, Entwicklung und Implementierung von BI-Lösungen und Dashboards zur Visualisierung von Daten
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Kunden und internen Teams, um Geschäftsanforderungen zu verstehen und maßgeschneiderte Lösungen zu liefern
Bereitstellung von Schulungen und Unterstützung für Kunden zur effektiven Nutzung von Business-Intelligence-Tools und -Plattformen
Kontinuierliche Weiterentwicklung von Fachkenntnissen in Bezug auf BI-Technologien, -Methoden und -Best Practices



Qualifikation

Dein Talent


Abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften oder einer verwandten Disziplin
Nachgewiesene Berufserfahrung im Bereich Business-Intelligence oder der Datenanalyse, idealerweise in einer Beratungsrolle
Expertise in BI-Tools wie z.B. Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, Cognos Analytics, SAS VA, SAP Analytics oder ähnlichen Plattformen
Starkes Verständnis von Datenbanken, Datenmodellierung und Abfragesprachen (z.B. SQL)
Idealerweise Kenntnisse in Python oder ein allgemeines Verständnis über die Grundlagen der Programmierung
Analytisches Denkvermögen und die Fähigkeit, komplexe Probleme zu lösen
Ausgezeichnete Kommunikations- und Präsentationsfähigkeiten
Teamorientierung und die Fähigkeit, effektiv in multidisziplinären Teams zu arbeiten
Fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse



Es ist unwahrscheinlich, dass jede:r Kandidat:in all diese Anforderungen erfüllt. Wenn Deine Erfahrungen anders sind und Du glaubst, dass Du einen Mehrwert für die Position bieten kannst, lass uns gerne darüber sprechen!

Benefits

Unser Versprechen

Wir bieten Dir eine Kultur, die von unseren Führungsleitsätzen angetrieben wird: unternehmerisch, ergebnisorientiert, Eigenverantwortung fördernd und sich gegenseitig zum Erfolg verhelfend. Wir schaffen Transparenz über Unternehmensziele, Zusammenarbeit und Unterstützung durch ein internationales Team auf Augenhöhe. Wir leben Austausch, Teamgeist und einen respektvollen Umgang miteinander. Das verbindet uns hierarchieübergreifend – auch im Home-Office. So erhielten wir in 2022, 2023 und 2024 die kununu Auszeichnung „TOP Company“.

Das erwartet Dich bei uns:


Onboarding: Vernetzung ab dem ersten Tag - Welcome Day, Hello Drink, Mentoring-Programm.
Entwicklung: Individuelle Förderung Deiner Stärken - Regelmäßige Feedbackgespräche, Karrierepfade, Career Committees, Online-Trainingskatalog, internationales Arbeiten mit verschiedenen Kulturen.
Work-Life-Balance: Raum für Deine Lebensplanung - Sabbatical, Remote Working aus dem Ausland, flexible Arbeitsmodelle, Elternzeitprogramme, 30 Tage Urlaub, Feiertagskalender Baden-Württemberg.
Nachhaltigkeit: Unsere Arbeit hat einen positiven Einfluss auf die Umwelt und die Gesellschaft - wir machen unsere Lösungen und Zusammenarbeit jeden Tag nachhaltiger.
Events: Fachliche und unterhaltsame Events - Summer-Tech-Event, lokale Afterworks, Sportevents, Teamevents, Weihnachtsfeiern.
Netzwerken: Verbinde Dich mit internationalen Kolleg:innen - Communities, Lunch Breaks, interne Know-How Sessions.
Fehlerkultur: Teste Dich aus und lerne aus Fehlern - Wir geben Dir Freiraum, mit neuesten Technologien zu arbeiten.
Prämien: Zahlreiche Prämien für zusätzliches Engagement.
Weitere Vorteile: Digitales Mobilitätsbudget, Corporate Benefits, Jobfahrrad, Deutschlandticket, betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement.



Schau Dir unsere CBTW Spotify Playlist an und erhalte einen ersten musikalischen Eindruck von unserem Team: https://open.spotify.com/playlist/44kgWZRt5jmmgppH0qGszg?si=L312ch\_9SMKsCKBcN-EB\_A

Aber genug von uns, jetzt bist Du an der Reihe - Wir freuen uns darauf, Dich kennenzulernen!

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Marketing/Measurement
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

This specific position is within our Marketing Analytics and will be focusing mostly around helping improve and creating measurement tools to determine the ROI of our performance marketing campaigns.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis and statistical models to evaluate and steer marketing decisions
Maintain and improve our marketing measurement tools (Attribution, experimentation framework, Customer lifetime value…)
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Develop new methodologies to scale our Display and Partnerships channel, among others
Serve as a liaison between the marketing teams and the data engineering team
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg, pandas, scikit-learn, pyspark)
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Prior exposure to digital and performance marketing
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice to have


Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus
Previous experience in marketing attribution and customer lifetime value


How We Set You Up For Success


Invest in your development with an annual personal growth budget
Create a comfortable workspace at home with an annual home office budget
Enjoy flexibility with a hybrid work-from-home and telecommuting policy
Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Citywire is on the lookout for a talented Junior Data Analyst to join our team. This role offers the opportunity to work closely with business stakeholders, helping them unlock the potential of their data to drive key decisions and achieve their goals.

As a Junior Data Analyst at Citywire, you'll be at the heart of our data-driven initiatives. You'll collaborate with various teams across the company, helping them understand their data needs and delivering the insights they require. This is an exciting role for someone who enjoys working with data, solving complex problems, and driving projects that make a real impact.

What you’ll be doing:


Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their data requirements and provide the data they need to meet their goals.
Extract data from various sources and produce clear, insightful reports that support business decisions.
Dive deep into datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that can guide strategic decision-making.
Work alongside the Data Engineering team to ensure data is properly structured for analysis and reporting and collaborate with Development teams to ensure accurate data capture at the source.
Help colleagues across the business become data champions within their own departments by providing them with the tools and knowledge they need.
Lead and contribute to engineering projects based on the company’s data needs.


What we’re looking for:


Communication Skills: Ability to clearly communicate complex data concepts to colleagues at all levels.
Analytical Approach: Strong analytical skills with the ability to work with complex datasets and build reports from raw data.
Data Visualisation: Proficiency in visualising data in a way that’s easy to understand for non-technical stakeholders.


Experience in:


SQL: Proficient in manipulating data using SQL.
Google Big Query: Experience with Google Big Query or similar platforms.
Visualisation Tools: Familiarity with data visualisation tools such as Looker Studio or equivalent.
NoSQL Databases: Experience working with NoSQL databases.
Cloud Platforms: Experience with AWS, GCP, or similar cloud platforms.
Excel/Google Sheets: Strong skills in Excel and Google Sheets.
Power Query: Experience with Power Query is a plus.


Meet Citywire

We cover - and connect - all sides of the $100 trillion global asset management industry - through our news, events and insights.

At Citywire, we uphold a culture rooted in honesty, integrity, and fairness, where every voice is valued and heard. Our culture promotes constructive dialogue and collaboration on a global scale.

Join the team at the forefront of the global asset management industry.

Our perks:


Generous holiday entitlement: Start with 25 days per annum, increasing to 28 days after three years' service, and 30 days after five years' service, in addition to bank holidays.
Flexible working options.
£480 annual allowance for well-being activities or gym memberships, with assistance available for monthly or annual costs.
Eye-test and glasses allowance.
Competitive private pension scheme.
Critical illness cover and group life assurance from day one of employment.
Well-being support: Access to an independent Employee Assistance Programme, available 24/7.
Cycle to work scheme and annual travel card loans.
Techscheme: Purchase the latest tech through our employer scheme, spreading the cost over 12 months with National Insurance savings.
After two years of continuous service, access group income protection, private medical, and dental insurance.


Citywire is an equal opportunities employer.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Role

At Deliveroo we have an outstanding data science organisation, with a mission to enable the highest quality human and machine decision-making. We work throughout the company - in product, business and platform teams - using analysis, experimentation, causal inference and machine learning techniques. We are uniquely placed to use data to help make better decisions and improve data literacy across Deliveroo.

We are looking for a Data Analyst that is passionate about metrics and telling the stories behind the data. We have several roles open across different teams (grocery, loyalty, restaurants). Data Analysts at Deliveroo report into our data science management team.

You will be a professional in insights storytelling, communication and visualisation and know how to create action from metrics. Crafting effective intelligent benchmarks, understanding performance, caring about data quality, enabling automation and creating phenomenal visualisations and stories are things that drive you.

What you'll be doing



Work closely with commercial stakeholders to create value and business impact through better data availability, visualisation and analysis
Discover, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets to perform ad-hoc analyses and deliver insights to the executive team and senior management
Understand key drivers of the business and provide data driven guidance on key levers
Identify and specify data needs and quality requirements and work closely with Analytics Engineers to ensure data is available, accurate and corresponds to the business needs
Consolidate and distribute best analytical practices from different teams and countries



Requirements



Experience identifying the root cause of problems, assessing risks/impacts and determining and implementing effective solutions.
A good understanding of querying in SQL and understanding of database structure - you'll be expected to be able to extract the data you need for your analysis.
Compelling story-telling skills, and an eye for powerful visualisations - you'll need to translate your findings for all levels of stakeholder (business and technical)
Good knowledge of Excel/GSheets - depending on the task, there is a good chance that this is where some of your exploratory analysis will take place. Being comfortable with pivot tables and functions will be essential.
Developer experience with a data visualisation tool (Looker, Tableau, Periscope)



Why Deliveroo

Our mission is to transform the way you shop and eat, bringing the neighbourhood to your door by connecting consumers, restaurants, shops and riders. . We are transforming the way the world eats and shops by making access to food and products more convenient and enjoyable. We give people the opportunity to buy what they want, as they want it, when and where they want it.

We are a technology-driven company at the forefront of the most rapidly expanding industry in the world. We are still a small team, making a very large impact, looking to answer some of the most interesting questions out there. We move fast, value autonomy and ownership, and we are always looking for new ideas.

Workplace & Benefits

At Deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritise their welfare. Benefits differ by country, but we offer many benefits in areas including healthcare, well-being, parental leave, pensions, and generous annual leave allowances, including time off to support a charitable cause of your choice. Benefits are country-specific, please ask your recruiter for more information. This role in a Hybrid position.

Diversity

At Deliveroo, we believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest-growing businesses in a rapidly growing industry.

We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion in all aspects of our hiring process. We recognise that some candidates may require adjustments to apply for a position or fairly participate in the interview process. If you require any adjustments, please don't hesitate to let us know. We will make every effort to provide the necessary adjustments to ensure you have an equitable opportunity to succeed.

Please click here to view our candidate privacy policy.

Please click here to view our candidate privacy policy.
Show more
HTML:
The Role

At Deliveroo we have an outstanding data science organisation, with a mission to enable the highest quality human and machine decision-making. We work throughout the company - in product, business and platform teams - using analysis, experimentation, causal inference and machine learning techniques. We are uniquely placed to use data to help make better decisions and improve data literacy across Deliveroo.

We are looking for a Data Analyst that is passionate about metrics and telling the stories behind the data. We have several roles open across different teams (grocery, loyalty, restaurants). Data Analysts at Deliveroo report into our data science management team.

You will be a professional in insights storytelling, communication and visualisation and know how to create action from metrics. Crafting effective intelligent benchmarks, understanding performance, caring about data quality, enabling automation and creating phenomenal visualisations and stories are things that drive you.

What you'll be doing


  • Work closely with commercial stakeholders to create value and business impact through better data availability, visualisation and analysis
  • Discover, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets to perform ad-hoc analyses and deliver insights to the executive team and senior management
  • Understand key drivers of the business and provide data driven guidance on key levers
  • Identify and specify data needs and quality requirements and work closely with Analytics Engineers to ensure data is available, accurate and corresponds to the business needs
  • Consolidate and distribute best analytical practices from different teams and countries


Requirements


  • Experience identifying the root cause of problems, assessing risks/impacts and determining and implementing effective solutions.
  • A good understanding of querying in SQL and understanding of database structure - you'll be expected to be able to extract the data you need for your analysis.
  • Compelling story-telling skills, and an eye for powerful visualisations - you'll need to translate your findings for all levels of stakeholder (business and technical)
  • Good knowledge of Excel/GSheets - depending on the task, there is a good chance that this is where some of your exploratory analysis will take place. Being comfortable with pivot tables and functions will be essential.
  • Developer experience with a data visualisation tool (Looker, Tableau, Periscope)


Why Deliveroo

Our mission is to transform the way you shop and eat, bringing the neighbourhood to your door by connecting consumers, restaurants, shops and riders. . We are transforming the way the world eats and shops by making access to food and products more convenient and enjoyable. We give people the opportunity to buy what they want, as they want it, when and where they want it.

We are a technology-driven company at the forefront of the most rapidly expanding industry in the world. We are still a small team, making a very large impact, looking to answer some of the most interesting questions out there. We move fast, value autonomy and ownership, and we are always looking for new ideas.

Workplace & Benefits

At Deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritise their welfare. Benefits differ by country, but we offer many benefits in areas including healthcare, well-being, parental leave, pensions, and generous annual leave allowances, including time off to support a charitable cause of your choice. Benefits are country-specific, please ask your recruiter for more information. This role in a Hybrid position.

Diversity

At Deliveroo, we believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest-growing businesses in a rapidly growing industry.

We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion in all aspects of our hiring process. We recognise that some candidates may require adjustments to apply for a position or fairly participate in the interview process. If you require any adjustments, please don't hesitate to let us know. We will make every effort to provide the necessary adjustments to ensure you have an equitable opportunity to succeed.
