Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Mandatory secondary language (Mossi/Mooré)

About the Company - This team focuses on safeguarding the billions of users across our clients family of apps from harmful content, malicious actors, and detrimental behaviors. By leveraging cutting-edge technology and collaborating with cross-functional teams worldwide, the team plays a crucial role in creating and upholding a secure and positive environment for the global community. In this organization, you will have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact by promoting integrity and fostering trust among users, businesses, and partners alike.







About the Role - As a member of this team, your role will involve responding to real-time crises while also proactively recognizing and assessing emerging risks. You will perform risk-related investigations and consider ways to better support our communities through improved strategies and practices. Leveraging your comprehensive knowledge of our clients systems, including tools, products, policies, and processes, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to implement tailored mitigation plans addressing various operational risks across platforms, domains, policies, and regions. This role places you at the center of managing crises, elections, and unconventional issues arising on our platforms, ensuring the continued safety and well-being of our user communities.




Responsibilities




Serve as an expert to interpret and enforce our clients’ terms of service. (including but not limited to Community Standards, Advertiser & Commerce Policies and Product specific guidelines)
Investigate and resolve emerging risks that are reported on our clients’ products, such as requests for account support and potentially abusive content including but not limited to graphic images, videos and writings, offensive or derogatory language, and other objectionable material across organic, ads and commerce.
Gather, analyze and utilize data from escalations and content/ad reviews to develop improvements for the overall escalation process, policies, products, and generate operational insights for the supported community
Showcase grace under pressure and ensure effective and timely collaboration with multiple internal stakeholders including but not limited to Public Policy, Core Policy, Legal, Sales, Product and Engineering
Adapt to changing requirements and prioritize escalation requests effectively
Liaise closely with our our clients’ vendor teams to ensure all operational KPIs meet and exceed targets and work collaboratively to improve processes and tools and scale solutions.
Work as part of a 24/7 global team, including the potential for on-call shifts during weekends/after-hours when needed.
Mandatory secondary language (Mossi/Mooré) requirement to use a combination of language and market specific geopolitical knowledge, deep understanding of cultural, language nuances and minority communities, to capture signals and insights to enforce and solve complex risk and operational issues within the region.




Qualifications




2 to 4 years of experience in Trust & Safety or Online Operations for a tech company, consulting, operations or similar roles
Strategic thinking with a proven track record of enhancing customer experience through innovation and continuous improvement
Strong communication skills and ability to build relationships and influence stakeholders across functional boundaries and globally
Ability to work with graphic and objectionable content coupled with a broad understanding of our clients’ Community Standards
Ability to make judgments under tight deadlines and competing priorities
Proficiency/ Basic knowledge in analytical tools (e.g., Excel, SQL) for driving analytics, reporting and operational decision-making







Pay range and compensation package - Approx. £70,000 (Plus Benefits) | London (Hybrid)

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
twentyAI are proud to be partnered with a leading live entertainment and experiences business who have received recent investment from one of the leading funds globally. The events business has a history of annual revenue of over €100 Million.

They are looking to add a Data Analyst to their finance team that investigates ticket sales and marketing effectiveness in order to further advance their operations and increase market share. This role also looks deeply into customer journeys both virtually and physically.




As a Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in being the 1st point of contact for the commercial finance team and a variety of their various operational partners. They need someone who is enthusiastic and willing to solve complex data problems.

Key skills:

Confident using SQL to query.
Skilled in PowerBI
Keen interest in Azure automation
Strong business acumen




Exposure to snowflake, Airtable & Python is beneficial but not necessary.




Due to the exposure this role has to senior board members and external parties it is imperative that the candidates has impeccable communication skills both written and verbally.

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Data Analysis?

If you are detail orientated, perceptive, organised, competent, analytical and can communicate well with those around you; you could have a truly rewarding future as a Data Analyst

We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of £50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:


Junior Data Analyst - £30,000
Data Analyst - £50,000
Business Data Analyst - £67,500
Data Analytics Analyst - £80,000
Business Analysts - £60,000


Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.


Microsoft excel - to expert level.
Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.


Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
JOB TITLE –Data Analyst - Marketing

Location - London




Your New Company

With over 244 offices in 33 countries across the globe, Hays are the largest specialist recruitment agency. Hays is recognised in the recruitment sector for its industry leading training & development opportunities.




Role Objectives

The Senior Data Analyst works within the UK&I Marketing Department to develop and deliver reporting and insight analysis to all business stakeholders.







Responsibilities

Creating dashboards and reports using Excel and Power BI
Support the monitoring of marketing campaign performance across the department
Maintain and deliver monthly KPI and ROI reporting for the UK&I management board and to support the marketing planning team at regional ops meetings
Creating and maintaining documentation for processes and best practices
Improve access to data sets and bring together to automate use where possible.







Skills and Competencies

Good understanding of Marketing Principles
Work autonomously, but collaboratively, demonstrating ownership in ALL activities
Demonstrates behaviour which supports the Hays brand values: Expert; Ambitious; Inquisitive; Passionate about People
Capable of interpreting data in order to make sound and timely business decisions
MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint skills essential
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work effectively under pressure and to strict deadlines




Essential

Proven ability to design visually impactful dashboards and tell a meaningful story
Experience with complex DAX queries
Using Power Query to load, transform, and curate the data
Strong SQL skills for querying and creation of views/tables, functions, and stored procedures
Logical mindset and strong attention to details
Project management skills




Desirable:

Proficiency in Excel (pivot tables, formulas, shortcuts etc)
Experience with SFMC automations
Knowledge of Python
Experience with Microsoft Azure platform & service (eg DataFactory, Fabric)
Proficiency in PowerPoint
Experience with Google Analytics/Looker Studio




What you will get in return

As a global FTSE 250 business, Hays can offer you all the tools for a successful career. This is the ideal opportunity for someone with minimal experience looking to build a career in Bids and Contracts. You’ll join the team with clear objectives set out for career progression plus all the training and support you could ask for. Hays works on a flexible hybrid basis where you’ll be able to work 50% from home and 50% from our central offices. You’ll also have access to all our wide range of benefits including cycle to work, private healthcare options, buy & sell leave, shopping discounts, dedicated services for mental health support & wellbeing plus a monthly wellbeing hour to use at your own discretion plus our paid volunteering day for all employees under our Working for Your Tomorrow InitiativCulture built on rewarding success and the opportunity to influence your earning potential.




Best technology in the industry and a renowned training programme to support success and drive rapid career progression and ongoing development
Flexible hybrid working patterns
Opportunity to take your career globally
Incentives and rewards to recognise performance both locally, regionally and nationally
Broad range of employee wellbeing initiatives and benefits
Referral bonus scheme
Community of internal support networks.
Paid volunteering days for all employees under our Working for Your Tomorrow Initiative.




Life at Hays presents the opportunity for growth, varied career paths, exciting challenges and a culture of inclusion that celebrates diversity. As a committed Disability Confident employer, if you’re thinking of a new tomorrow for your career, whatever your background, let’s work together to create it!




At Hays, we share a passion for creating a culture of opportunities for our people to flourish and succeed, whatever your background. We know that diversity of perspective and an inclusive approach, which encourages those experiences and views to be heard, is great for business and therefore your career.

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Data Analysis?

If you are detail orientated, perceptive, organised, competent, analytical and can communicate well with those around you; you could have a truly rewarding future as a Data Analyst

We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of £50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:


Junior Data Analyst - £30,000
Data Analyst - £50,000
Business Data Analyst - £67,500
Data Analytics Analyst - £80,000
Business Analysts - £60,000


Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.


Microsoft excel - to expert level.
Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.


Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The ideal candidate will use their passion for analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics, enabling the to improve the product. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users.

Responsibilities

Understand the day-to-day issues that our business faces, which can be better understood with data.
Compile and analyze data related to business' issues
Develop clear visualizations to convey complicated data in a straightforward fashion




Qualifications




Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics or Applied Mathematics or equivalent experience
3+ years' Data Analysis experience
Proficient in SQL, BI tools (any flavour), Python nice to have

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our Mission

We're not your average benefits platform; we're the unordinary force that uplifts people's lives. Our technology is the link that connects the entire benefits ecosystem, creating better outcomes for employers, employees, brokers, and providers.

Our mission is clear: we're here to create a world where everything operates at its very best, ensuring that every employee receives the support they need to live life to the fullest, both at work and beyond.

Your Mission

As a Data Analyst at Ben, you will be joining at a crucial time in the evolution of our product-engineering organisation as we build out the foundational pillars of our data function.

This is an incredible opportunity to join a business where we are looking to build out our analytical function from scratch. You will be owning a number of tools and work closely with the product and business teams to define KPIs, perform exploratory analysis and set up reporting that will drive the business towards being truly data-driven.

Things you will be working on…


Be the first port of call for the business in triaging data issues, determining the root cause and resolving where appropriate
Work collaboratively with our Marketplace, Product, Support, Operations, Customer Success and other engineering teams to resolve issues in a timely fashion
Maintain our service levels with customers by ensuring queries are investigated and resolved within SLA timeframes
Support the business in making data driven decisions and carrying out repeatable analysis
Develop reporting and dashboards to enable the business to track trends and perform business-critical analysis at scale
Establish processes to root cause and solve open-ended problems
Be an expert on the product - understand and communicate the underlying concepts within the product, be the point of contact when supporting other business functions in their understanding of the products dataflows


You’ll Love This Role If You Have


SQL expertise: you can debug complex queries to optimise for both quality and performance
The ability to identify the root cause of data issues and working with engineering teams to resolve them in a timely manner
Experience with a BI/visualisation tools such as Looker, Metabase, Lightdash. You know how to design and build dashboards to enable repeatable analysis
An analytical mindset: you know how to turn raw data into actionable insights. You have experience defining KPIs and building the reporting to measure them
Familiarity with dbt is a nice to have


and you...


are a self-starter who thrives on autonomy, enjoys a rapid pace and wants to make a difference
have a continuous improvement mindset. You appreciate that there are always ways to do things better and ensure your team does too
have a preference to action-oriented behaviour with just enough analysis, as compared to too much time spent doing analysis with no action
have the ability to make decisions balancing different factors such as business requirements, technical integrity, overall priorities etc.
appreciate the opportunities and challenges of a distributed work environment
are solution-focused with a pragmatic approach to problem-solving


Diversity and Culture at Ben

We are organically growing a brilliantly diverse, inclusive and respectful bunch of people we are extremely proud of. This should go without saying but all applications are very much welcome. If you need any adjustments to support you with your application, just let us know by emailing jobs@thanksben.com.

Our BENefits

(... It's all in the name! 😉)

💰 Competitive base salary and equity, so you own what you build

💳 £100 monthly personal Ben Balance: for whatever works for you, whether that's Netflix, Spotify, or a really expensive cup of coffee! This allowance will increase by £50 for each year of service until you reach £250

🔋 £1000 annual Learning & Personal Development Ben Balance: plus 3 days paid study leave a year to support you with your professional development

👩🏽‍💻 £500 work from home set up allowance, which you can put towards your home office

🍔 Weekly lunch provided in office so you can spend quality time with the team over some tasty food!

🏖 28 days of holidays a year (plus bank holidays, which you have the option of swapping for days of celebration that are significant to you)

🌴 ...and an option to buy or sell 5 days per year. Also, your holiday entitlement will increase to 30 days at your 3rd year of service!

🍼 Enhanced parental leave and workplace nursery scheme to support with the cost of childcare in a nursery setting

🧠 Comprehensive and tailored mental health support through a leading provider

💪 Access to a Gympass membership!

❤️ Comprehensive Private Medical Insurance

🍿 Team activities: we have quarterly team social budgets to support spending time together and we frequently organise company wide events

📅 Hybrid Working - we work 3 days in the office, 2 days remotely
Show more

📅 Hybrid Working - we work 3 days in the office, 2 days remotely

Title: Business Data & Reporting Analyst
Description:
Our client, a leading independent academic and professional publisher, is seeking a Business Data and Reporting Analyst to support their Hybrid and Open Access journals’ editorial function. This role involves developing and delivering analytics and reporting solutions that transform data into actionable insights.




Business Data & Reporting Analyst: Key responsibilities




Implement, manage, maintain, and develop existing reports and dashboards across the Journals Editorial function
Quickly acquire a good understanding of the critical data sources regarding availability, integrity, complexity and ownership to ensure reports and analyses are complete, consistent and understood
Troubleshoot, resolve and drive improvement to existing reporting and data visualisations, with a keen interest in automation
Effectively prioritise and manage multiple data-focused requests through delivery with a high degree of accuracy and on time completion
Help evaluate acquisitions of new third-party data sources and assist in implementing and using these sources to achieve business benefits for Editorial







Business Data & Reporting Analyst: Skills/experience




A proven record of collaborative work with other highly skilled data analysts and data coordinators to produce and present clear reports and data visualisations that are user-friendly and accessible to stakeholders
Data analyst experience and applied critical thinking and analytical skills to solve real-world business problems
Knowledge of the journal publishing industry and an understanding of Open Access business models
Advanced experience with Microsoft Office 365 apps (including advanced skills in Excel and proficiency in Power BI, along with DAX, Power Query, and Excel Power Pivot), SQL, and API integrations
Good relationship management skills and confidence in dealing with people at all levels of the business




A competitive salary, bonus, and benefits package is offered.




Referral Scheme - Telfer Partners offer a referral reward if we fill this vacancy with someone you recommend. You can send us contact details of anyone you would like to recommend to enquiries@telferpartners.com.




Equality Policy - Telfer Partners is committed to upholding a professional and impartial recruitment process. Our Equal Opportunities policy ensures that all job applicants and employees are treated fairly and equally, regardless of their gender, sexual orientation, marital status, race, nationality, religion, age, disability, or union membership status.

Show more

  • Quickly acquire a good understanding of the critical data sources regarding availability, integrity, complexity and ownership to ensure reports and analyses are complete, consistent and understood

  • Good relationship management skills and confidence in dealing with people at all levels of the business


A competitive salary, bonus, and benefits package is offered.


Referral Scheme - Telfer Partners offer a referral reward if we fill this vacancy with someone you recommend. You can send us contact details of anyone you would like to recommend to enquiries@telferpartners.com.


Equality Policy - Telfer Partners is committed to upholding a professional and impartial recruitment process. Our Equal Opportunities policy ensures that all job applicants and employees are treated fairly and equally, regardless of their gender, sexual orientation, marital status, race, nationality, religion, age, disability, or union membership status.

Title: Data Analyst - Digital
Description:
Working at the RFU means being part of the ‘bigger picture’ at England Rugby: to be rooted in our purpose, which is to enrich lives, introduce more people to rugby union & develop the sport for future generations. If our purpose resonates with you, and you recognise the value that sport can bring to people’s lives, we’d love to work with you. An opportunity has arisen for a Digital Marketing Analyst (Web) to join the team on a permanent basis.




Job Title : Data Analyst - Digital

Department : Marketing

Reports to : Senior Customer Data Analytics Manager

Job Level : Implement

Location : Twickenham

Employment Type : Permanent




Application Information:

Please submit an anonymised CV and cover letter (i.e. please exclude personal details).
The closing date for applications is Friday 26th July at 5pm.
The RFU reserves the right to close this vacancy early if we receive sufficient applications.
Applications may be considered whilst this vacancy is advertised.




To download the full job description for this role, please click here.




Nature and Scope:




The RFU has been undergoing a period of significant change, responding to changes in the external environment whilst adjusting to the demands of a modern governing body. The organisation is currently one year into delivering an exciting strategic plan that hopes to have a transformational impact on Rugby Union.




As part of this strategic plan, the RFU has an ambition to become a data-driven, user-centric organisation with market leading digital capabilities that will not only transform the rugby experience for players, volunteers and fans today, but also future proof the RFU for years to come.




As part of a small Customer Data & Analytics team, you will play a key role in helping the RFU's Marketing & Digital Team transform the experience for our customers through analysis of marketing data and audiences. The role will enable growth for analysts with a digital first mindset and a passion for customer experience whilst contributing to the overall success of the RFU and England Rugby.




The role will analyse web data to identify patterns and trends in order to improve engagement and conversion.
The role will help to augment and improve the quality of data captured.
The role will support marketing campaigns and identify audience preferences.
The role will measure and assess marketing campaigns to provide insight.
This role will measure performance of web advertising.
This role will measure the performance of experiments (e.g. A/B) on the website in collaboration with the Digital Product Team.




What will you be doing?




Some key responsibilities include:

Developing a comprehensive web analytics strategy to deliver the company's digital objectives from platform down to tagging.
Creating and maintaining a roadmap to deliver data quality and enhanced analytics capabilities.
Managing and optimize Google Tooling to ensure accurate data collection and reporting to track benefit realisation and support prioritisation decision-making.
Leading the effort to improve overall analytics effectiveness including segmentation opportunities and personalisation to drive engagement and advocacy.
Supporting the development of new ways to evaluate our digital assets and grow our commercial revenues through key websites.
Analysing web data to identify opportunity areas to optimise performance and improve the overall digital experience.
Creating and delivering regular reports on web performance to the wider business.
Acting as an ambassador for, and promoting the best interests of the RFU, including the promotion of the RFU core values.




Your approach to Life (your behaviours):

You're a strategic thinker who is able to influence and drive change.
You have strong influencing and consensus building skills, and you're able to build sustaining relationships.
You're able to work collaboratively.
You are process driven and able to work well under pressure.
You're able to inspire confidence and create trust.
You possess sound judgement and the ability to think creatively to reach desired goals.




What you Know:




Essential:

Demonstrable experience in a data analysis role or another quantitative field.
Expertise in Google Analytics 4(GA4) and Google Tag Manager (GTM) (GAIQ certified preferred).
Experience in go-to-market, configuring GA4 & GTM to measure success by defining tags, triggers, variables, data streams, events, and enhanced measurement features.
Experience with other web feedback capture tooling e.g. Hotjar, Optimizely.
Proficient with reporting tooling e.g. Looker / Tableau.
Good breadth of knowledge of digital analytics to make recommendations on tooling, best practices, and strategic approach.
Proficiency in debugging and troubleshooting Google analysis-related issues.
Experience with web analytics, A/B & MVT strategy and implementation requirements.
Knowledge of GDPR and other privacy around handling user data.
Effective communication and problem solving ensuring the right people are involved and updated.
Good understanding of software development practices and web/mobile technologies.
Committed to actively contributing to and building an inclusive culture in your role and day to day behaviours.




Desired:

Experience with Salesforce and Marketing Cloud Intelligence (previously Datorama).
Experience with a Customer Data Platform.
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Data Science, Business Analytics, Maths, Sciences).




Additional Information:

We want you to have every opportunity to demonstrate your skills, ability and potential. If there is anything we could do to support you through your application or to provide the best environment for your interviews, including assistance or adjustment, please reach out to recruitment@rfu.com.
During your application, we will ask questions about your identity. This information is considered highly confidential and will not be seen by hiring managers. You can find out more about why we ask these questions here.




To download the full job description for this role, please click here.

Title: Data Analyst – Digital & Creative Agencies
Description:
Fantastic opportunities available for impressive and award winning global agencies working with a breadth of well-known and household brands.




Our clients are a mix of creative, digital, & media agencies who are looking for data talent to transform raw data into actionable insights and aid business critical decision making.




Hybrid working- circa 3 days a week in a London office
Negotiable salary depending on level of experience




The role:




Link data and tech with creativity to provide statistics and data driven insights to their clients marketing & business challenges
Partner with the internal data teams (Data visualisation, Data science) to ensure you work together to solve all client data driven challenges
Develop and maintain data systems, preparing detailed reports, and presenting findings to stakeholders
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators.
Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies, providing insights that drive business decisions and enhance client campaigns.
Continuously seeking ways to improve data collection and analysis processes
Drive measurable results
- Staying updated with the latest industry trends and technologies to implement best practices.




The person:




Inquisitive with an analytical mindset
Ambitious and career driven
Previous experience working in a marketing or creative agency
Experience using data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, or R, along with experience in data visualisation software like Tableau or Power BI.
A solid understanding of statistical methods and data modelling techniques
Experience in customer journey analysis and planning
Ideally a degree in a relevant field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or Economics
Attention to detail, a high level of accuracy, and the ability to work under pressure




We are committed to ensuring and supporting representation from all backgrounds across the creative industry, irrespective of race, religion, belief, ethnicity, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability or socio-economic background.

With this in mind, we welcome applications from all areas of the community. Please do get in touch and let us know if there is any additional support or reasonable adjustments we can cater for, to ensure our process and roles fit your needs and creates a comfortable & enjoyable recruitment process.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT US:

Townhouse was created with a single goal: to disrupt and reinvent the global nail salon industry. We are the fastest growing beauty brand in the UK and are driven by a passionate and disruptive team in achieving our mission.

We've brought together a world class team from a wide range of industries. And as we're growing extremely fast, we need brilliant people (like you!) - to join us on our journey and help us deliver our goal.

ABOUT THE ROLE:



As a Junior Data Analyst at Townhouse, you'll play a pivotal role in our data-driven journey. This is a hands-on, multifaceted role perfect for a generalist who enjoys wearing many hats and thrives in a start-up environment. You'll be responsible for data manipulation, presentation, and analysis, with a strong emphasis on automation and problem-solving. You'll work closely with different parts of the business, providing insights that will directly influence our strategic decisions.

Key Responsibilities:


Handle BAU reporting and ensure data is presented in a clear and actionable manner.
Automate BAU reporting and other general data processes to increase efficiency.
Conduct analyses such as customer behaviour analysis, commercial pricing, location modelling, demand prediction, and utilisation.
Gather data through customer surveys and interviews.
Constantly explore new ways to improve existing processes and build innovative solutions from scratch.


ABOUT YOU:


Relevant industry experience.
A generalist mindset, with a desire to take on multiple roles and build things from the ground up.
Proficiency in Excel/spreadsheets, data manipulation, and data visualisation.
Strong mathematical and analytical problem-solving abilities.
Strong communication skills with high emotional intelligence; able to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Detail-oriented and conscientious.
Experience with automation tools (e.g., Tableau, basic programming, Excel macros).
Knowledge of SQL is a bonus but not a necessity.


LOCATION:   

Our office is based in Central London and we offer a discretionary hybrid working model, based on the requirements of the role.

EMPLOYEE BENEFITS AT TOWNHOUSE: 


Private healthcare and wellness support – Benefit from the nail industry's first private healthcare package including free telephone / video GP appointments and treatment in private hospitals if there is a long wait on the NHS.
Shopping discounts - a range of discounts on some of the largest brands to save you money every day.
Birthday Pamper Party: During your birthday month, bring a friend for a free signature manicure/pedicure and a glass of bubbles!
Social Budget - Every month your manager gets a budget to spend pampering you and your team. Expect treats, lunch at work or a night out – to be agreed with your manager!
Holiday on us: An extra day paid holiday on your annual allowance for every whole year you have been with Townhouse - up to 5 extra days!
Employee Discount: 75% discount on treatments
Interest free advance - To cover you for any emergencies and to avoid interest costs, we will provide up to a £50 advance for every day you have worked for us in a month.
Refer a Friend: Earn up to £550 for every successful hire you introduce to Townhouse.


Socials:

Discover more about us: 


Visit Our Website
Follow us on Instagram
Follow our Careers Page on Instagram


Equal Opportunities: 

Townhouse is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, embracing diversity without compromise. We celebrate all qualified applicants, irrespective of race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or disability status.

Join us in defining sophistication in the world of nail artistry! 

Apply Now and Be Part of Our Exceptional Team!

Title: Data Analyst (SQL/EXCEL) GLOBAL SAAS!
Place: Kingston Upon Thames, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Are you a driven and recent IT Graduate with a strong passion for Data and Analytics? Do you have 1+ years of experience working as a Data Analyst? Are you looking for a real challenge? This company has been trading for 20 years!. Do you love data?

You will be joining a very well-funded SAAS software company who has recently received a HUGE CASH INJECTION! So it's now time to grow the Data team. APPLY NOW!!!

This is an amazing chance to join a progressive company with a long-term career on offer to move into Data Analysts, Data Engineering and to work for a GLOBAL SAAS Company who works with the S&P 500 companies to make a big impact!.

The Data Analyst must have at least 1+ years' experience. This is a great role for a second jobber!

Overall, the purpose of this role will be to maintain and ensure the quality of the data, ensuring timeliness of data availability.

This is a hand-on and fast paced role that requires pragmaticism and problem solving skills.

Key Responsibilities


Downloading and adding data into a global database
Data validation and correction using in-house applications, Excel and SQL Server Management Studio
Investigation of new patent data sources
Dealing with helpdesk support queries
Working with the development team regarding data extraction and application troubleshooting
Specification writing of new in-house applications
User Acceptance Testing of new in-house applications
Ensuring data quality with emphasis on attention to detail
Ensuring all data feeds are completed on time
Data source ownership and process reviews in order to improve speed, accuracy and automation opportunities


Person Spec


Good communication, detail orientated, methodical and numerate
Experience of querying databases using SQL Server
Excellent computer skills including Word and Excel
Excellent oral and written communication skills


Interviews will be arranged ASAP.

2 Stage process and quick turnaround.

Hybrid working 2 days in the office in South West London (excellent transport links including people who live close to the overground, district line, Piccadilly line and national rail) and 3 days from home. More flex on offer for the right person but this is a hybrid working role.

Excellent Benefits on offer

Pension

Bonus

25 days holidays +8 Bank Holidays

Robert Half Ltd acts as an employment business for temporary positions and an employment agency for permanent positions. Robert Half is committed to equal opportunity and diversity. Suitable candidates with equivalent qualifications and more or less experience can apply. Rates of pay and salary ranges are dependent upon your experience, qualifications and training. If you wish to apply, please read our Privacy Notice describing how we may process, disclose and store your personal data: roberthalf.com/gb/en/privacy-notice

Security alert: scammers are currently targeting jobseekers. Robert Half do not ask candidates for a fee or request candidates to send applications through instant messaging services such as WhatsApp or Telegram. Learn how to protect yourself by visiting our website: roberthalf.com/gb/en/how-spot-recruitment-scams-and-protect-yourself

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (SQL / PowerBI) | £40,000 - £50,000 | 4 Days / Per Week (West London)




Here at Burns Sheehan, we have partnered up with a well-established name in the UK market for over 20 years who have just been bought out by an experienced leader in the gambling industry as they look to invest heavily within growth and explore International Markets.




As a result, they are looking for a Data Analyst to join the team and report into the Head of Analytics as one of the 1st key hires in this initial growth phase. In this role you will be responsible for taking over the curation and development of a suite of Power BI reports, which are used across all areas of the business to help drive strategy and run the day to day mechanics of the organisation.




Skills and Qualifications:




Bachelor's or Master's degree in Physics, Computer Science, Mathematics or Similar...
2 + Years experience within Data Analysis
Proficient in SQL / T-SQL and PowerBI (Potentially Tableau)




With a two-decade presence in the UK, this company has a proven track record of success and customer loyalty this an amazing time to join as the companies goes from strength to strength. If you are a Data Analyst with excellent experience across both SQL and PowerBI feel free to apply and I will get back to you accordingly !!!




Data Analyst (SQL / PowerBI) | £40,000 - £50,000 | 4 Days / Per Week (West London)

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Data Analysis?

If you are detail orientated, perceptive, organised, competent, analytical and can communicate well with those around you; you could have a truly rewarding future as a Data Analyst

We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of £50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:


Junior Data Analyst - £30,000
Data Analyst - £50,000
Business Data Analyst - £67,500
Data Analytics Analyst - £80,000
Business Analysts - £60,000


Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.


Microsoft excel - to expert level.
Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.


Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us:Goldstar is a leader in the transport and warehousing industry, committed to excellence and continuous growth. Our mission is to deliver outstanding results while fostering a culture of integrity, collaboration, and professional development. As we continue to expand, we are offering an exciting opportunity for a talented individual to join us a Data Analyst.

As a Data Analyst at Goldstar, you will be responsible forcreating and maintaining dashboards, reports, and systems to provide valuable and actionable insights into the business.You will also play a key role supporting the Business Analyst and IT team with the development, implementation, and maintenanceof our TMS system and API/EDI interfaces, to ensure seamless data integration.

About The Job

Full Time, Permanent

Location - Colnbrook

Monday to Friday (42.5 hours/week)

Salary £28,000 - £32,000per annum

Key Responsibilities


Develop, maintain, and optimise dashboards and reports using Power BI, Alteryx, Power Automate, and Cognos to provide actionable insights.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity in reports and dashboards by performing regular data validation and quality checks.
Analyse datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Collaborate with the Business Analyst to understand reporting requirements and develop data solutions that meet business needs.
Assist in translating business requirements into technical specifications for reports and data models.
Provide ad-hoc data analysis and support for various business units as required.
Assist in the maintenance of our Transport Management Systems, ensuring that they are running smoothly and efficiently.
Support, maintain and assist in the development of API/EDI system interfaces to ensure smooth and efficient connectivity and data flow.
Work with IT and other teams to troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues in our systems.
Identify opportunities for automation within the data reporting process and implement solutions to reduce manual workload.
Document processes, data flows, and reporting methodologies to ensure consistency and knowledge sharing across the team.
Provide training and support to end-users on how to use dashboards and reports effectively.
Assist in continuously reviewing operational processes for efficiency.


What are we looking for from you to join us:


Experience using data analytics and business intelligence tools such as Alteryx, Tableau, Power Automate, Power BI.
Advanced Excel skills, including pivot tables.
Strong analytical thinking with the ability to interpret complex datasets and provide meaningful insights.
Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy and quality.
Creative problem solver who can identify opportunities for process improvement.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills to effectively collaborate with team members and stakeholders.
Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
An understanding of the transport and logistics industry is desirable.
Understanding of API/EDIconnectivityis beneficial but not essential.


How We Help You Thrive


28 days annual leave.
Free onsite parking.
Workplace Pension.
EAP for employees at work.
Employee committee meeting.
Mental health and wellbeing.
Sage Benefits.
Learning and development.
Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Please note this is a hybrid role which will require attendance in our St Albans office at least once a week:

About The Role

Are you excited by what data can uncover? Do you have a natural ability to think analytically? Are you intrigued by the impact a website can have on an individual’s decisions? We have the role for you!

Joining our Technology team, you will have the opportunity to demonstrate and further develop your data analysis skills in this brand-new role. The Junior Data Analyst role will suit a highly numerate and enthusiastic individual who will bring an analytical mindset, lateral thinking, and a fresh perspective.

Working closely with our Marketing team and other stakeholders across the business, the primary focus for the Junior Data Analyst will be to support the business in leveraging data analysis, identifying data-led opportunities, and creating data-driven insights for business decision-making.

To help you learn our systems, you will also be helping our testing team with some of our web testing work. We have found this to be a really effective way of initiating junior staff and helping you gain that all important system and database knowledge. You may also be called upon to conduct web testing on an ad-hoc basis on other occasions for example covering leave or when we may have a backlog of testing to complete.

You will ideally have had a minimum of 1 year’s experience in a similar role and we will also consider new graduates who can demonstrate a real passion for data and some experience of the key skills listed below.

Your main duties:

As a Junior data analyst we won’t be expecting you to do all of this from day 1! You will be fully supported to help you achieve these goals…


Deliver actionable insight by collecting, analysing and interpreting business data to help drive informed business decisions.
Creating complex SQL queries to extract data for analysis from Microsoft SQL Server and MySQL databases using Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio and MySQL Workbench.
Helping the test team with functional web testing when required.
Analysing business performance to identify and implement areas for improvement and growth opportunities.
Collaborating on data analysis projects to measure and report web data and marketing performance. This will include using tools such as Google Analytics.
Developing and maintaining marketing analytics models to optimise campaigns and customer targeting.
Analysing customer behaviour and campaign performance to provide actionable insights and recommendations.
Making and extracting data-led recommendations for pieces of external content related to the property and legal services industries/Press Releases.
Creating data-driven dashboards and reports to communicate business insights to stakeholders using Power BI.
Continuously developing processes so that deliverables are created in the most efficient way to improve performance, using automation.


Education/qualifications

About you

We welcome candidates educated to degree level or equivalent in a numerate subject and those without a degree who can demonstrate a suitable level of knowledge and work experience.

Skills, Knowledge And Abilities


Confidence and solid experience using SQL to extract and analyse data
Ability to create reports and visualise data into charts and graphs using Power BI
You know how to use Excel with experience of creating formulae
An understanding of how relational databases work
Excellent attention to detail, numerical and analytical skills, and the ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Some awareness of the UK housing market and home moving
Demonstrable ability to clearly and concisely summarise data into consumable content (e.g. in PowerPoint) for a wide audience including senior leadership
Ability to manage multiple priorities, meet deadlines, and adapt to changing requirements in a dynamic environment.
A passion for data-driven decision-making, problem solving and a customer-centric mindset.
IT literate and competent with the Microsoft Office suite
Strong teamwork skills, time management, motivation, and ability to work autonomously.
Be enthusiastic to join a growing business and therefore be flexible to new demands.


Knowledge of any of the following would be advantageous:


More detailed knowledge of conveyancing, surveying types, Stamp Duty Land Tax, freehold, leasehold, shared ownership and other matters related to home moving in the UK.
Google Analytics (GA4)
Google Tag Manager (GTM)
Power Automate
Power Query


Motivation


Ability to work on own initiative
Willing to adapt and learn new skills
You will also feel at home with our values;
Customer obsessed: We start with the customer and work backwards
Ambitious: We think long term, we think big and we value calculated risk taking
Humble: We are vocally self-critical and respectfully challenge others’ opinions
United: We are one team
We’re people people: We care about our colleagues and the communities we live and work in


What can we offer you?


Discretionary annual bonus
25 days holiday per annum
Your birthday day off.
An extra day’s leave when you move house (per annum)
Up to 5 days of unpaid leave for those unexpected life events
Flexible approach to hybrid working
Enhanced Pension Scheme
Free unlimited book allowance for work-relevant publications
A very healthy annual training budget for use on courses, classes, qualifications or professional memberships. You decide how you can grow best
Employee Assistance Programme .
and much more as outlined on our careers page


What To Expect From Our Recruitment Process


Online HR interview approx. 45-60 minutes
Technical Test
Face to Face Interview - with hiring manager, Head of Technology and Head of Marketing - approx. 60 minutes
Show more

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.

  • Microsoft excel - to expert level.
  • Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
  • Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
  • Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.

Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Citywire is on the lookout for a talented Junior Data Analyst to join our team. This role offers the opportunity to work closely with business stakeholders, helping them unlock the potential of their data to drive key decisions and achieve their goals.

As a Junior Data Analyst at Citywire, you'll be at the heart of our data-driven initiatives. You'll collaborate with various teams across the company, helping them understand their data needs and delivering the insights they require. This is an exciting role for someone who enjoys working with data, solving complex problems, and driving projects that make a real impact.

What You'll Be Doing


Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their data requirements and provide the data they need to meet their goals.
Extract data from various sources and produce clear, insightful reports that support business decisions.
Dive deep into datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that can guide strategic decision-making.
Work alongside the Data Engineering team to ensure data is properly structured for analysis and reporting and collaborate with Development teams to ensure accurate data capture at the source.
Help colleagues across the business become data champions within their own departments by providing them with the tools and knowledge they need.
Lead and contribute to engineering projects based on the company's data needs.


What We're Looking For


Communication Skills: Ability to clearly communicate complex data concepts to colleagues at all levels.
Analytical Approach: Strong analytical skills with the ability to work with complex datasets and build reports from raw data.
Data Visualisation: Proficiency in visualising data in a way that's easy to understand for non-technical stakeholders.


Experience In


SQL: Proficient in manipulating data using SQL.
Google Big Query: Experience with Google Big Query or similar platforms.
Visualisation Tools: Familiarity with data visualisation tools such as Looker Studio or equivalent.
NoSQL Databases: Experience working with NoSQL databases.
Cloud Platforms: Experience with AWS, GCP, or similar cloud platforms.
Excel/Google Sheets: Strong skills in Excel and Google Sheets.
Power Query: Experience with Power Query is a plus.


Meet Citywire

We cover - and connect - all sides of the $100 trillion global asset management industry - through our news, events and insights.

At Citywire, we uphold a culture rooted in honesty, integrity, and fairness, where every voice is valued and heard. Our culture promotes constructive dialogue and collaboration on a global scale.

Join the team at the forefront of the global asset management industry.

Our Perks


Generous holiday entitlement: Start with 25 days per annum, increasing to 28 days after three years' service, and 30 days after five years' service, in addition to bank holidays.
Flexible working options.
£480 annual allowance for well-being activities or gym memberships, with assistance available for monthly or annual costs.
Eye-test and glasses allowance.
Competitive private pension scheme.
Critical illness cover and group life assurance from day one of employment.
Well-being support: Access to an independent Employee Assistance Programme, available 24/7.
Cycle to work scheme and annual travel card loans.
Techscheme: Purchase the latest tech through our employer scheme, spreading the cost over 12 months with National Insurance savings.
After two years of continuous service, access group income protection, private medical, and dental insurance.


Citywire is an equal opportunities employer.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We're hiring the very best data analysts to join our agile in-house team. You will be working on the fastest growing direct to consumer (e-commerce) brands and will have access to unlimited performance bonus.




What You'll Be Doing




Launch and optimize social, native and search advertising campaigns
Improve Conversion Rate across multiple funnels - multivariant and A/B testing
Design new funnels and analyse granular data using proprietary data warehouse
Manage unlimited budget while staying profitable. Compensation is directly correlated to your personal campaign performance and paid monthly
Optional managerial roles available




What You'll Need




Results-driven and numbers-oriented personality
High attention to detail
Flexibility and adaptability
Commitment to innovations




A little about us




We're passionate about building life changing consumer products and delivering them with astonishing service. We are also one of the UK's fastest growing direct to consumer companies.




The Benefits




Salary above market
All the latest tech you need
Pension plan

Title: Data Analyst - up to £45,000 Bonus Benefits - Hybrid
Description:
Data AnalystSalary: up to £45,000 + Bonus + BenefitsLocation: 2/3 days onsite near London BridgeWorking Hours: 9am - 6pm with 1 hour for lunchContract: Permanent A rapidly growing client who is looking to expand their data function is looking to hire a Data Analyst to drive insights for their key products and shape product analytics. The Data Analyst will have the opportunity to increase their responsibilities, take ownership of projects and progress up the ladder.Data Analyst - Responsibilities:


Generate valuable insights for core products, including advanced deals, mobile applications, experimentation tools and identity protection features.
Utilising visualisation techniques to help present/explain product performance and key businesses insights
Partner closely with the product team to drive revenue generation, guide product evolution and inform key decisions.
Utilise technical expertise to process and analyse large-scale datasets, transforming complex data into meaningful insights for product teams.
Explore intricate data sets to uncover opportunities that enhance product performance and support the execution of strategic initiatives.
Use their centralised reporting system to aid in strategic decision-making and revenue optimisation.
Collaborate with product and data teams to create and sustain data models and performance metrics for new product experiments.


Data Analyst - Essential Skills


SQL - extract insights, write queries & manipulate data
Any data visualisation tool experience - creating dashboards & reports and commenting on trends


Data Analyst - Desirable Skills


Looker, BigQuery
A degree


If you are interested in working for a rapidly growing organisation who will give you the chance to grow and develop in the business, be influential in helping the data analytics function grow and work on key products then please apply in the immediate instance.

Data Analyst, Data Analytics, SQL, Tableau, Power BI, BigQuery, Looker

Title: Data Analyst - TikTok LIVE - London
Description:
Responsibilities

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.
Join us.

The LIVE Operations team is obsessed with everything to do with TikTok LIVE. Our focus is to continually champion and optimize TikTok LIVE through working with creators to ensure a creative, fun and safe space for all of our users.

The Regional LIVE Operation Strategy Team leads various cross-functional projects. Our key initiatives include developing strategic plans to drive widespread adoption of LIVE at scale among creators, localizing new product features, creating user engagement strategies, ensuring a positive creator experience through education on the Community Guidelines and best practices, and providing ad hoc analysis and support to cross-functional partners.

Responsibilities:
- Analyzing local and global trends to help improve performance within the EU LIVE team
- Creating and preparing reports and dashboards to help us better identify areas of focus and trends within our ecosystem

Examples of Problems You'll Be Solving:
- What are the best content verticals for us to focus our creator recruitment on?
- Building a prediction model for identifying creators who may be destined for success on our platform
- Which metrics and leading and lagging indicators should we use for our key OKRs?
- How should we best segment our creators and users to have a more meaningful impact on their growth?
- What are the best touchpoints to educate our creators, and when should we activate this education?
- Using statistical tools to simplify complex data sets, helping us better diagnose issues and propose solutions

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:
- Minimum 3 years of working experience in data analysis
- Strong mathematical skills to measure, collect, and analyze data
- Proficiency in statistics and experience using data visualization software such as Tableau, PowerBI, or Looker
- Knowledge of SQL and any programming languages
- Attention to detail

Preferred Qualifications:
- Bachelor’s degree in STEM (science, technology, engineering, math); Advanced Degrees are preferred
- Python is highly preferred
- Attention to detail

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
Show more
